She is thinking about expanding the business and converting it into a cafeteria that is equipped to provide all types of products.

This is her fifth loan from MFP. Mirja is careful to make each of her payments on time. She plans to invest the money she requested in more merchandise to restock her kiosk. At the same time, part of the money will be used to buy cloth for making uniforms to sell at the school. This will help her continue improving her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her concession stand & fabric for making school uniforms

loans.name: Nasandelger

texts.en:
Nasandelger is 42 years old and lives with her father and two children in a house in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughter, 21, attends university and her son, 17, attends a local secondary school. 

Nasandelger makes and sells wooden products. She began her business in 2003 with 150,000 tugrugs (~105 USD) of working capital.  Her business succeeded and her working capital now exceeds 1,496,000 tugrugs (~10500 USD).   She has gained business experience and advanced carpentry skills.  

Nasandelger's customers know that she makes quality, beautiful products and that Nasandelger is trustworthy and conscientious.  She says, “I want to expand my business and own my own workshop for the future.”  Nasandelger is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan to purchase more wood for her business so she can keep it growing.

loans.use: Purchase more wood.

loans.name: Sanjaadorj

texts.en:
Sanjaadorj, 34, lives with his wife and four children in Zavkhan province, in western Mongolia.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent.  Their oldest two daughters, 10 and 12, are secondary school students.  His wife babysits their two infants. 

He operates a wooden product making business. He produces wooden items used in ger construction and traditional ger furniture.  He makes all of the parts of a ger in under three months and sells each ger for between 2,500,000-3,500,000 tugrugs (1760-2460 USD). His business is very popular and his customer base includes people from inside and outside his province. 

Sanjaadorj started his business in 1990 and has made much progress over the years. He is a savvy businessman and always looks for ways to improve his operations. He says, "I began to build a house for my family and hope to finish it in near future."  Sanjaadorj is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: Purchase wood and materials.

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
Suhbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two month old infant in a house in Arhangai province in central Mongolia.  His wife is a dressmaker and she sews a variety of traditional clothes and shoes. 

Suhbaatar operates a taxi service. He started his business in 2007 and since then has doubled his orking capital. He uses his own car to transport people around his local area.

He says, “In order to make and sell shoes during the national holiday, “Tsagaan Sar,” we would like to purchase more fabric with a loan.”  He is requesting a 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan.  Suhbaatar is planning to expand both his and his wife's businesses in the future.

loans.use: Purchase materials and fabrics.

loans.name: Null

texts.en:
Mr. Null S. S. O. is single and is a villager in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. He is a pig breeder and aside from that he is a wine maker.

Since his business is going well Mr. Null S. S. O. wants expand it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to make wine to sell. The rest of the loan he would use to buy pig feed to support his pig breeding business.

Mr. Null S. S. O. hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make wine to sell and feed for his pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is fifty-three years old. Lourdes is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling sweets and confectioneries, such as cookies and cakes in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 120,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Lourdes's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther P., from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 24 years old, married and the mother of an infant. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop whose income comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is thirty-one years old. Mercy is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling eggs in the local community. Mercy is just starting this business. She was able to engage in the food-vending business with a previous loan.

In 2009, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand the number of products she could offer. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Mercy's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is fifty-seven years old. Elvira is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP that she will use to invest in expanding her business. This will be Elvira's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Pheuy

texts.en:
Mr. Pheuy P. is 30 years of age and a resident of Siem Reap Province. To feed his family, Pheuy P. plants rice and a few vegetables on his land near his house, which he will sell when they come to maturity. He is married to Mrs. Seang P., age 37, who sells fish paste. She buys fish paste in bulk from the people who live along the river and she then sells it retail in the market for a profit. 

Pheuy P. needs some supplies and is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticide for his crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticide.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S., age 31, is married to Mek Reth, age 50. They are parents who are blessed with two children who go to school and are dependent on them. Chea S. and her husband depend on income from their annual business catching fish in and around the river. They sell the fish they have caught to market buyers. The couple has many years of fishing experience and usually earns at least $10 each day that they use to pay for their family’s daily expenses. Recently some of their fishing equipment was ruined and their income has been affected. Therefore, Chea S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair broken equipment and to buy extra accessories for fishing.

loans.name: Shun

texts.en:
Mrs. Shun T. is a villager in Svay village in the Kandal province and she is 57 years old. She is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Rorn Mom, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice to support their family. loans.name: Tab

texts.en:
Mrs. Tab L., 54, lives in a big wooden house with other family members. Her house is along a river that has been affected by flooding. To earn a living, Tab L. and her husband always wake up in early morning to prepare and then go to the middle of the river in their own boat to fish. After they finish their fishing, they hurry to bring their fish to retailers in the busy local market near their house. 

They are parents who have given birth to five children; one is married and lives independently while the other four are dependent on their income. 

Tab L. wants to increase the quantity of fish that they catch, but this requires more fishing equipment. Because Tab L. lacks money, she decided to borrow a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. She will buy many sets of fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy many sets of fishing equipment

loans.name: Cherly's Group

texts.en:
Cherly P. is from Kinuman Norte Ozamiz City. She is 23 years old. Cherly is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cherly is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Cherly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, noodles, sugar, salt, coffee, some foods for snacks and etc. in the local community. Cherly has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cherly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherly is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cherly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sari Usaha Group

texts.en:
The Sari Usaha Group has 10 members, all of whom are married women from Bali, Indonesia. Their ages range from 30 to 55 years and each woman has between 1 and 3 children. Their children's education ranges from primary school through high school. The Sari Usaha Group is located in the Nusasari Village about 5 kilometers from Melaya Village. The group is chaired by Ni Ketut Pertami. The group is getting a loan to expand their businesses in pig breeding. This loan will be used to buy pig food, repair cages or to buy piglets.

Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner MUK will be in contact primarily with the group representatives who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers.  As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.  This collection of 10 women is a subset of a larger 60-woman community loan that is being offered by MUK.

To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please copy and paste this URL into a new browser window: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking

loans.use: used to buy pig food, repair cages or to buy piglets.

texts.en: Tomas M. is from the city of Mambajao in Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Tomas is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Tomas provides motorela (a motorcycle with a passenger compartment) transportation to local community members. Tomas has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Tomas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tomas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Tomas is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Tomas's 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer L. is from the village of Poblacion 4 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Jennifer is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of different products such as canned goods and soy sauce, in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Jennifer's 10th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maricel

Maricel A. is from the village of Poblacion 1 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Maricel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel sells new clothing to local community members. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50000 PHP from GDMPC. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Maricel's 17th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Lourdes' Group

texts.en:
Lourdes U. is from the village of Santa Cruz in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old. Lourdes is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lourdes is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lourdes plants, harvests, and sells vegetables, like "kalabasa" (squash) in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be Lourdes's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is from the village of Centro 2 in Mallig, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Lucena is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lucena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Lucena's 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina N. is from the village of Centro 2 in Mallig, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Victorina is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Victorina owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Victorina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Victorina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Victorina is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Victorina's 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mr. L., age 51, lives in the rural area of Kompong Chhnang Province. L. works as a requirement laborer. People hire him to build new houses or to harvest their mature crops. His wife stays at home to do housework and care for their children. In addition, the family cultivates a rice crop for extra income. L. has two single daughters who sew clothes for a factory. 

L. and his family do not have a sanitary house, because their house does not have a toilet. Therefore, L. is applying for a loan to build a bathroom in his house.

loans.use: To build a bathroom in their house

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin V. is a 28-year-old man who lives in a house in Kompong Chhnang Province. Sin V. is an internal staff member in the Ministry of Social Affairs. He earns a salary of $180 per month to pay for his family’s expenses. He has a partner in his wife, a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals for family and also cares for their child. The family's youngest child is enrolled in primary school. 

Sin V. is taking this loan to purchase a used motorcycle to help him commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Soeu S. is 60 years old and lives with another family member in Kampong Chhnang Province. She has built a stall next to her house where she raises animals to earn a living. She breeds animals such as pigs, ducks and chickens. Then, when the animals are mature, she sells to buyers. Additionally, her husband plants a rice crop for a profit. Soeu S. conducts her trade very well because she knows how to raise pigs well. In order to make additional income, she is requesting a loan of $500 USD to buy small pigs, ducks, and chickens to breed.

loans.use: To buy small foods, pigs, ducks, and chickens to breed.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Давронов Илхом проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Давронов Илхом занимается растениеводством более 6 лет. Он вносит минеральные удобрения в почву. Обрабатывает и проводит севооборот. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Ilhom D. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. Ilhom has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He puts mineral fertilizers into the soil, treats it and conducts crop rotation. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: S., born in 1968, is located in Kampong Chhnang province. She has established a small family business with other members. Currently S. is a professional Khmer teacher who teaches a class in the secondary level of school. In addition, she has built a bigger stall behind her house where she operates another business line, raising many pigs. In this sector her business partner is her husband. He assists her in breeding pigs. Due to the fact that raising pigs is successful and is profitable  for her family, S. wants to accumulate many piglets to feed by using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To accumulate many piglets to feed.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.en:
K. Dilnoza is 24 years old. She and her husband, a woodworker, have a little daughter. Dilnoza sells blankets at the market. She has been in this business for two years. As a rule, Dilnoza travels to the neighboring town every week to purchase new goods. She tries to choose a variety of goods with good quality and attractive prices. This allows her to keep her clientele. Today Dilnoza requests 4000 Somoni. She’ll spend the loan for purchasing  new goods. She promises to pay the loan back on time. She thanks everyone for support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods, purchasing of new knitted jackets, skirts, sweaters for selling.

loans.name: Urunbek

texts.ru: Каршиев Урунбек проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Каршиев Урунбек имеет среднее образование. Растениеводством занимается более 5 лет. Он вносит удобрение и обрабатывает почву разными способами. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Urunbek K. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. Urunbek has a secondary education. He has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He uses fertilizer and treats the soil by various other methods. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Asalmo

texts.en:
M. Asalmo is 30 years old. She is married and has three children. Asalmo sells clothes for women at the central city market. The location of her vending store is very favorable as it’s in a busy place. Asalmo has been in this trade for 5 years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Asalmo is hoping to take a loan of 4000 Somoni to increase the variety of inventory in her store and to keep her business running successfully. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children.

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Y. Mavluda sees herself as a calm, hard-working, and responsible person. She began her business due to the need for an income, aside from her husband’s, to cover the household expenses. They have a child who grows each day, along with their financial needs. 
She began, some time ago, selling different products. She even had a home-made food shop which she had to close because of the increase in the shop’s rent, and because the owners were asking for the shop. So, one of her friends convinced her to sell clothes and offered to take her to places where she could buy clothes at good prices. She followed her friend’s advice and began to sell clothes 6 years ago. Her sales went very well after she started. She now has a fair number of clients. Mavluda asks for 4000 Somoni to purchase seasonal garments. She wants to take advantage of the dates and to have a more diverse variety of garments for her clients, which will allow her to increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchasing of the clothing for women.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael Antonio Zeledón Martínez de 26 años reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su madre y un hermano menor. Juntos elaboran pan francés, el cual es el nombre que se le da al pan tipo baguete en El Salvador. El pan es elaborado en su hogar, el cual es comercializado en el mismo lugar.  Así mismo cuenta con varios clientes quienes compran por mayoreo el pan. Rafael cuenta con 3 años de elaborar el pan francés, negocio con el cual ha logrado brindarles todo lo necesario a su madre y su hermano. Debido a que es esta es la única fuente de ingresos que posee, él solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar toda la materia prima para elaborar el pan. Ingredientes tales como harina, levadura, manteca y otros más, son necesarios para obtener mayores ganancias, lo que beneficiará a su familia ya que le permitirá invertir más en el negocio, puesto que podrá tener mayor producción, más ganancias y de esta manera obtener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio Zeledón Martínez, 26, lives in San Salvador department with his mother and younger brother. Together, they make French bread, which is what the typical baguettes in El Salvador are called. They bake and sell the bread at home. He has several customers that buy the bread wholesale. Rafael has been baking for three years and this commercial activity has provided for all his mother's and brother's needs. Because this is his only source of income, he needs funding to buy the raw ingredients he needs for his bread. These are: flour, yeast, lard, etc. They are needed in order to produce higher profits which will benefit his family and allow him to invest more in his business and produce larger yields and higher profits. All this will lead to better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast and lard for bread-making.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena S. de 49 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y un hijo, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Ella cuenta con 7 años de dedicarse a la venta y elaboración de tortillas y pupusas, dos tipos de alimentos, los cuales son muy básicos en la alimentación diaria de los salvadoreños. Razón por la cual María solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder invertir más en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de maíz, arroz, frijoles, chicharrón y todos los productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos. Debido a que es la única venta de tortillas y pupusas que esta ubicada en las cercanías de su hogar, ella cuenta con mucha demanda por parte de clientes los cuales compran en ese lugar debido a la dedicación que Maria tiene para elaborar sus productos. Tanto María como su esposo y su hijo, dependen en gran manera de este negocio, debido a que es el que les permite solventar gran parte de sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
. María Elena S., 49, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department, with her husband and son, who is in school. She has sold tortillas and pupusas (maize dumplings) for 7 years; these are two types of food that are basic to the Salvadoran daily diet. Maria needs funding to invest more in her business by buying larger amounts of corn, rice, beans, chicharrón (fried pork) and all the other ingredients needed to make her products. Because this is the only business of its type in her surrounding area, demand for her products is high especially because Maria shows so much dedication in making them. María, as well as her husband and son, depend to a great degree on this business because it provides for a large part of family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, beans and chicharrón (fried pork).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, eggs and yeast for bread-making.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Rejoice is 40 years old and married to a peasant. She has eight children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC, a Kiva partner, started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirna Elizabeth H. F. de 24 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Vicente. Vive junto a una hermana, su cuñado y sobrinos, esto debido a que sus padres se vieron en la necesidad de emigrar a los Estado Unidos. A pesar de esto, Mirna decidió seguir adelante y poder iniciar su propio negocio, el cual es una venta de ropa para mujeres y hombres, dicho almacén de ropa está ubicado en el centro de San Vicente, lugar el cual siempre tiene una gran afluencia de personas, y debido a que su negocio está ubicado en la calle principal cuenta con muy buenas ventas, las cuales se incrementan los fines de semana. Así de esta manera es como Mirna se gana la vida, trabajando muy duro por mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y poder surtirlo con más mercadería. Es por esta razón por la que Mirna solicita un préstamo, ya que ella desea poder comprar mucha más ropa en diferentes tallas y colores, la cual siga la tendencia de la moda actual, de manera que pueda incrementar sus ventas, y de esta manera contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Mirna es una joven muy emprendedora, la cual es muy admirada en el lugar, por sus grandes deseos de seguir adelante y valerse por ella misma y que siempre está tratando de superarse y obtener nuevos retos en la vida.
texts.en:
Mirna Elizabeth H. F., 24, lives in San Vicente department with her sister, brother-in-law, and their children, because her parents emigrated to the United States. Despite this, Mirna decided to forge ahead and set up her own business. She sells clothing for men and women in a store that is located in downtown San Vicente, an area that has a lot of foot traffic and, because it is on the town's main street, sales are very good, escpecially on weekends. This is how Mirna earns her livelihood, working hard to improve her business' condition and increasing her stock. This is the reason why Mirna is requesting funding; she wants to buy a greater variety of colors and sizes of fashionable clothing so that her sales will increase and she will have better economic stability. She wants to continue to make progress, to be self-sufficient; she is always striving to improve and to set new goals for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia J. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase crates of sodas and packed juice to sell. Lucia is 31 years old and married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase crates of sodas and packed juice to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes H. D. A. D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente. Vive junto a su hija y su madre D. 91 años D. edad, la cual necesita mucha atención médica, lo que incluye un enorme gasto D. medicinas. Mercedes posee un comedor y una venta D. tortillas, las cuales la elabora en las mañanas y mediodías. Durante largos años este negocio ha sido muy rentable para ella y su familia, lo cual la ha incentivado a querer surtirlo más, situación que le ha sido difícil, ya que posee grandes gastos D. medicina para su madre y la responsabilidad D. pagar mensualmente su casa la cual ha comprado a crédito. Es por ello que Mercedes solicita un préstamo, con el fin D. contar con la capacidad monetaria para adquirir nuevos productos y comprar mayor cantidad D. los que ya posee, tales como arroz frijoles, maíz, verduras, frutas y otros más. Esto con el deseo D. poder vender más comida y D. esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual le permita mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Mercedes H. D. A., 62, lives in San Vicente department with her daugther and her 91-year-old mother, who needs much medical attention, which means huge medical expenses. Mercedes has an eatery and she sells tortillas, which she makes mornings and afternoons. This business has been profitable for her and her family for many years. She has wanted to stock it better but this has been very difficult due to her mother's medical expenses and her monthly house payment which she must make. For these reasons, Mercedes is asking for funding to buy more supplies like rice, beans, corn, vegetables, fruits, etc. Her aim is to sell more meals so that her profits will increase thus improving her economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals preparation.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana G. S. de 52 años de edad, posee una venta de tamales, hechos a base de maíz, rellenos de carne de pollo, o hechos de hojas de chipilín, la cual al molerla forma una masa que se cocina y se rellena de verduras y otros ingredientes más, esta es una comida muy típica de El Salvador, la cual es muy rentable. Ella cuenta con más de 20 años de elaborar este platillo típico, en  Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el que reside junto a su esposo y su pequeño nieto, el cual está bajo la total responsabilidad de ella y su compañero de vida. El buen sabor de sus tamales le ha permitido ir haciéndose de muchos clientes a lo largo del tiempo, lo cual le ha dado el acceso de ir creciendo más y más en el negocio. Es por esta razón que Sebastiana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ingredientes como: maíz, pollo, verduras, hojas de huerta de guineos, la cual se utiliza para envolver los tamales y cocinarlos. Sebastiana es una señora muy estimada en su colonia, ya que siempre ha sido alguien muy responsable y trabajadora, quien en la actualidad se esfuerza por su pequeño nieto el cual se ha convertido en la razón de su vida.
texts.en:
Sebastiana G. S., 52, sells tamales. These are made with corn dough, filled with chicken or made with chipilín (a common leafy vegetable in the local cuisines of Central America, especially El Salvador and Guatemala. The leaves are high in iron, calcium, and beta carotene. They can be boiled and served green, dried and used as an herb, or added to tamale doughs for color and flavor) leaves which, when ground, form a dough that can be cooked filled with vegetables and other ingredients. This is a very typical dish in El Salvador and it is very profitable. She has made this dish for over 20 years in Lourdes Colón, which is in La Libertad department, where she lives with her husband and grandson, who is totally dependent on her and her husband. The good flavor of her tamales has gained many regular customers for her over time which has led to the gradual growth of her business. Sebastiana needs funding to buy larger amounts of ingredients like: corn, vegetables, banana leaves (which are used to wrap the tamales for cooking). Sebastiana is very well-liked in her neighborhood because she has always been very hard-working and responsible and who is now completely dedicated to her little grandson, who is her main priority in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, chicken and vegetables for tamales.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

Enike is 39 years old and married to a peasant. She has seven children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

loans.name: Linda Margaret

texts.es: Linda Margaret R. L. de 32 años, reside en el municipio de Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su hermana y un sobrino. Linda posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual ha tratado de ir surtiendo con el tiempo, pero a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos esto le ha sido imposible, ya que la mayoría de las ganancias son invertidas para el bienestar de su hogar y de esta manera contribuir junto a su hermana, la cual es madre soltera, con todos los gastos familiares. Es por esta razón que Linda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bebidas frías, productos que son muy vendidos es el lugar, lo que Linda desea aprovechar para poder mejorar sus ganancias. Ella es una persona muy trabajador quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, y quien siempre está buscando nuevas formas de mejorar sus ventas, ya que es consciente que solo de esta manera podrá mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
32-year old Linda Margaret R. L. lives in the municipality of Colón which is located in La Libertad department. She lives with her sister and nephew. Linda owns a store where she sells perishable products and basic necessities. She has tried to better stock her store as time has passed, but it has been impossible since the majority of her income goes towards household expenses. Her sister who is a single mother also contributes. Linda is asking for a loan to buy a bigger quantity of products such as rice, beans, sugar, and cold drinks. These items sell well in this location, and she wants to take advantage of that to increase her income. She is hardworking and gets good references from her neighbours. She is always looking for ways to boost her sales as she knows that this is the only way she will be able to improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, and cold drinks

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio G. de 47 años edad, reside en el municipio de Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su madre, la cual se dedica a los oficios del hogar, su padre quien trabaja como jornalero y una sobrina quien se dedica a estudiar. Juan Antonio posee una venta de repuestos para vehículos, la cual está ubicado sobre la calle principal de Ciudad Arce, lo cual es de mucho Beneficio para su negocio, debido a que está a la vista de todos los conductores. El negocio de venta de repuestos para automóviles ha sido muy fructifico para Juan, ya que gracias a este, ha podido brindarle estabilidad económica a su familia, así mismo ha contado con la capacidad de pagarle los estudios a su sobrina. Juan Antonio, solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio comprando accesorios y repuestos para  vehículos tales como, bujías, frenos, filtros para aire y aceite y otros más. Para él, el bienestar de su familia es primero, es por esto que desea mejorar las ganancias de su negocio, debido a que uno de sus mayores anhelos es poder brindar toda la seguridad y estabilidad económica que su hogar necesita.
texts.en:
47-year old Juan Antonio G. lives in the municipality of Arce in La Libertad department. He lives with his mother who looks after the home, his father who works as a day labourer, and his niece who is a student. Juan Antonio owns a business selling spare parts for vehicles. It is located in the main street of Arce, a really beneficial location as it can easily be seen by motorists. According to Juan the business has done well so he has been able to provide financial stability for his family and also pay his niece’s educational expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy accessories and spare parts such as spark plugs, brakes, air and oil filters, and other items. The wellbeing of his family is the most important thing for Juan and so he wants to increase the income from his business. One of his greatest wishes is to be able to provide all the security and financial stability that his family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles

texts.en: Teresita C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Teresita is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Teresita makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. loans.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.en:
The Flamboyan Group consists of 11 members, all women who have married. Their ages range between 25 and 50 years. They have two to four children each. Their children's education levels range between elementary school through high school. One woman has been able to finance her child's university education. 

This group proposed a loan of Rp. 11,000,000 and each member will receive Rp. 1,000,000. This loan will be used to buy piglets and pig food. The group is chaired by Ni Kade Citra Dewi. They hold monthly meetings to share information about their businesses, to collect savings and as a social gathering.

Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as village banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner MUK will be in contact primarily with the group representatives who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers.  As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. This collection of 11 women is a subset of a larger 60-woman community loan that is being offered by MUK.

To learn more about village banking on Wikipedia, please copy and paste this URL into a new browser window: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking

loans.use: Used to buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Gloria Angelica

texts.es: Gloria angélica M. de 44 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Desde hace 19 años Gloria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, negocio el cual es muy rentable para ella por el hecho de que no cuenta con ningún tipo de competencia en la zona. Ella posee la tortillería en su casa de habitación, lugar en el cual las personas llegan a comprar su producto diariamente, ya que las tortillas se comen todos los días, incluso acompañan a los alimentos hasta dos veces al día. Gloria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz al mayoreo, ya que ella desea aprovechar esta temporada en la que el maíz es más barato que en el resto del año. Para ella es de mucha importancia el poder vender más tortillas, esto debido a que sus hijos a medida van creciendo van teniendo necesidades extras, e incluso los estudios se van haciendo más caros, a pesar de esto Gloria desea poder brindarles todo lo necesario, razón por la cual quiere invertir más en su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
44-year old Gloria Angélica M. lives in the municipality of San Martín which is located in San Salvador department. She lives with her husband and two children who are students. For nineteen years Gloria has made and sold tortillas. Her business is very profitable because, as she says, there is no competition in the area. She runs the business out of her home, where her customers come to buy the tortillas on a daily basis. Tortillas are eaten everyday, and up to twice daily with meals. Gloria is asking for a loan to buy corn wholesale and take advantage of cheaper prices by buying at this time of year. It is very important to her to be able to sell more tortillas as her children are growing and will need extra things. As well, the cost of their education will get more expensive. In spite of these problems Gloria wants to be able to provide all the necessities of life for her family, so she wants to further invest in her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn

He will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to support their crops and increase their yield. He is a father of two children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory and the other is studying in a local public school.

In order to reach for a better living, Mrs. Hum S. decided to ask for a loan to add her savings and buy a piece of land to cultivate more rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

Apart from fishing, Ros H. and his wife cultivate rice. As his farm is located away from the watering system, Ros H. requests a loan to buy a pump to irrigate his rice crop. (Mr. Ros H.'s wife is in the picture).

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Barnaba K

texts.en:
Barnaba K. is 50 years old and husband to Salina Tala, who is 45 years old. They have been blessed with five children: Philemon (20 years), Joshua (19 years), Mathew (15 years), Sirma (10 years), and Boaz (8 years).

Barnaba runs a carpentry workshop, which is three years old. He normally gets a profit of Kes. 15,000 per month and also gets an additional Kes. 18,000 from other sources of income. His business is situated in Kabarnet town and most of his clients are local residents. Barnaba was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, who was already a client. He has borrowed a loan of Kes. 5,000, which he plans to use to purchase materials for his workshop. He anticipates getting a profit, which he plans to use open a furniture yard so that he will be marketing his own furniture.

Barnabas hopes to expand his business to other nearby towns and ultimately to give his children the best education. He describes himself as hardworking and patient.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his workshop.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Dy S. is 53 years old and lives with another family member in Kampong Chhnang Province. She has built a grocery shop along the road in the village where she earns a living selling various items including cooking ingredients and vegetables. She is a widow with three daughters who are employed. One is working in Malaysia and the other two are garment workers. Dy S. hopes to improve her current income by receiving a Kiva loan through HKL. It will be used to buy more stock and also to buy rice in bulk that can be stored and then sold later to generate income.

loans.use: To buy more stock and to buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Mrs. Hy Kruy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hy K. is 48 years old and the president of her village bank that consists of 20 people, all of whom live in Kandal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal province. The entire membership of the group will use this loan to support their businesses.

Mrs. Hy K. is a mother of three children, one is employed in a garment factory and the others are students in the local school. Mrs. Hy K. is a basket maker who does not earn enough income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it and so she is requesting a loan from AMK to buy more bamboo to make baskets. Her husband, Mr. Chin Thong, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field on which he cultivates rice.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo to make baskets.

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
Meralyn C. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 35 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Meralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Meralyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Meralyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina Y. is from the village of Batangan , Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Marlina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Marlina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Marlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Vanny Ut Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people who live in Kbal Kaoh Touch village, in Kandal province maK. up this village bank loan. Mrs. Vanny U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They will each use the loan for a different purposes. She is a grocer and Khmer caK. seller. In this business she has only a small capital to work with. She decided to ask for a loan to buy ingredients to maK. more cakes and she would use part of loan to buy more grocery goods to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Sophea Pech, is a construction worker who earns a small salary with which they support the family. Mrs. Vanny U. is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is still too young to attend school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to re-sell

loans.name: Evejella

texts.en:
Evejella Q. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 48 years old. Evejella is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evejella owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling firewood in the local community. Evejella has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evejella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evejella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Evejella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia P. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 48 years old. Delia is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

texts.en:
Eliza D. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 40 years old. Eliza is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Eliza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Eliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Eliza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom S. is 41 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. She was married, but divorced her husband, and she doesn't have any children. Prom S. owned a piece of farmland that she inherited from her grandparents, on which she plants rice and a few vegetables. She will harvest and sell when her crops come to maturity. Prom S. saw that a rice selling business is a suitable one for her to earn extra income. Because she doesn’t have money to invest in this business, she requests a loan to buy mature rice in bulk from other farmers to resell and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from other farmers to resell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Lucena is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as coffee, milo (a brand of malted milk), toothpaste and noodles in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately $330 a month from these activities.

In 2005, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 8th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

Evelyn Q. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 41 years old. Evelyn is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.
