loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Albertine Dohoué

texts.fr: H. Albertine Dohoué est née le 20 Juin 1983 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Albertine Dohoué est mariée à DJOI ASSOGBA Symphorien, un soudeur. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Agbato, un quartier de Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Albertine Dohoué n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Albertine Dohoué vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, piments, épices, etc.) et des légumes à son domicile. C’est à Adja dans le Mono (au Bénin) que Albertine Dohoué s’approvisionne. Albertine Dohoué est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Albertine Dohoué ambitionne renforcer son capital et agrandir davantage son étalage, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Cependant, Albertine Dohoué ne dispose pas d’assez de fonds pour y arriver. C’est pourquoi Albertine Dohoué sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Albertine Dohoué H. was born June 20, 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Symphorien DJOI ASSOGBA, a welder. The couple have four children, who are all in school. The family lives together in Agbato, a neighbourhood in Cotonou. The couple share household expenses. Albertine Dohoué has not attended school. To cope with her various expenses, Albertine Dohoué sells sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, hot peppers, spices, etc.) and vegetables from her home. She gets her supplies from Adja in the Mono region of Benin. Albertine Dohoué is a former beneficiary of ALIDé, having already been granted four loans, all of which were fully reimbursed. Her ambition is to bolster her working capital and expand her stall offerings to better satisfy her customers. However, she lacks the funds to do so. This is why Albertine Dohoué is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baskets of fresh tomatoes and hot peppers

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante C. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. He is 38 years old. Dante is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Dante owns and operates a business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Dante has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Dante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Dante is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nakry Heang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people and they all live in Kbal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nakry H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She is 60 years old and she is a vegetable seller. 

Since her business is going well, she wants to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Thol O., is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Nakry H. is the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, another is a laborer and the youngest is attending the local school. 

Mr. C. L. and Mr. Mali S. did not come to take out the loan but their wives did, so they are presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: María Angélica Noyola De Alas

texts.es: María Angélica N. D. A. D. 36 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a tres hijos D. 16, 12 y 9 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y por las tardes a ayudar a su madre con el negocio. María posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, así mismo elabora y venD. pupusas, las cuales las comercializa en las afueras D. su casa. Ella cuenta con 10 años D. poseer el negocio D. las pupusas, con el cual le ha ido muy bien ya que María posee muchos clientes los cuales en su mayoría por conocerla desD. hace muchos años, tienen la confianza D.  comprar pupusas D. muy buena calidad y sabor. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz al mayoreo, así mismo queso, arroz, frijoles y chicharrón, los cuales son los ingredientes principales D. las pupusas, esto lo hace con el fin D. contar con mayor cantidad D. materia prima lo cual le servirá para ofrecer más producto y D. esta manera obtener mayores ganancias. María es madre soltera, la cual trabaja muy duro para mantener a tres hijos y brindarles todo lo que ellos necesitan, es por esto que cuenta con el deseo D. mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Angélica N. D. A. is 36 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her three children, ages 16, 12, and 9, all of whom study, and also help their mother with her business in the afternoons. María has a perishable goods store and also makes, and sells, pupusas (filled tortillas) outsiD. her house. She has had the pupusa business for ten years and it has been going well since Maria has many customers most of whom have known her for many years. They trust that she will sell them high quality and tasty pupusas. María is asking for a loan so she can have the money to buy wholesale corn as well as cheese, rice, beans, and pork fat – the main ingredients for the pupusas. She would like to be able to count on having more prime materials to work with so she can offer more products and in this way gain more income. María is a single mother who works very hard to support her three children and give them everything they need. This is why she wants to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn (wholesale), cheese, rice, beans, and pork crackling

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay C. is 41 years old and a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province, where she has owned a plot of land that she inherited from her grandmother in 1979. On her land, she and her husband grow rice crops, which she plants twice a year. The couple has a child who attends school and also depends on their income. 

The daily income of this family is not adequate to support them. Svay C. would like to earn additional profits by investing in a new business, but she has no capital to start the process. Therefore, she is interested in requesting a Kiva loan through HKL to be used to buy mature rice from other farmers to resell to raise revenue.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en:
Ofelia J. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Ofelia is the group leader of a twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ofelia is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a business selling AVON and Natasha cosmetics and apparel products to the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $87 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Roucayatou Abébi

texts.fr: I. Roucayatou Abébi est née le 09 Octobre 1963 à Calavi au Bénin. Il y a près de 20 ans que Roucayatou Abébi s’est installée à Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à Akangbé OSSENI, Roucayatou Abébi est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Roucayatou Abébi vit ensemble avec ses enfants  et son mari à Hlacomey. Roucayatou Abébi vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Roucayatou Abébi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Roucayatou Abébi vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, des habits pour hommes et dames, par le système de distribution. Roucayatou Abébi s’approvisionne au Togo et au Nigéria, deux Etats voisins du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Roucayatou Abébi ambitionne augmenter le stock de ses produits, en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Cependant, Roucayatou Abébi n’a pas pu réunir les fonds nécessaires pour y arriver. C’est ce qui a conduit Roucayatou Abébi à solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Roucayatou Abébi I. was born October 9, 1963 in Calavi in Benin. She settled about 20 years ago in the Hlacomey area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Akangbé OSSENI, Roucayatou Abébi is mother of four children, all in school. She lives together with her husband and children in Hlacomey. Roucayatou Abébi helps her husband with the household expenses, thanks to the income generated by her activity. She has not attended school. To meet her needs over the past 15 years, Roucayatou Abébi has sold men’s and women’s clothing through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Togo and Nigeria, two neighbouring countries. Roucayatou Abébi is a former beneficiary of ALIDé, having already been granted three loans that she reimbursed in full. Her ambition is to increase her stock of supplies, to better satisfy her customers. However, she has been unable to gather the necessary funds to do so. For this reason she is now requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio M. G. de 30 años de edad, reside en Jayaque, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su padre y su madre. Luis Antonio posee un taller de venta y reparación de celulares, negocio el cual en los últimos años ha ido tomando fuerzas. Debido a la difícil situación que Luis Antonio atravesaba al no encontrar un empleo fijo, el decidió iniciar su propio negocio, en el cual repara todo tipo de celulares, así mismo vende accesorios para estos. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar celulares y repuestos, así mismo comprar cargadores, carcasas y chips de manera que pueda ir creciendo en su negocio y poder ofrecer más a sus clientes. Esto lo hace con el deseo de poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan brindarle mayor ayuda a sus padres y así mismo contar con una mejor estabilidad económica para su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio M. G., 30, lives in Jayaque, La Libertad department, with his mother and father. Luis Antonio has a cellular phone repair shop which has gathered strength in the last few years. Because of the difficult situation Luis Antonio was facing not being able to find a stable job, he decided to start his own business consisting in cellular phone repair; he also sells accessories for the phones. He is requesting funding to buy cell phones and replacement parts as well as chargers, cases, memory chips, etc. so that his business will grow and he will have more to offer his customers. He does this aiming to provide more support for his parents and have better economic stability for his family and home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cellular phone replacement parts and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish to re-sell

loans.name: G. Léocadie

texts.fr: Née le 03 Mars 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. G. Léocadie  est mariée à LOKO Simon. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Ahouassa à Cotonou. Léocadie vient souvent en aide à son mari pour assurer les charges de la famille, grâce aux revenus que lui procure son activité. Léocadie a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Léocadie vend depuis environs 8 ans, des habits pour enfants et des tissus, par le système de distribution. Léocadie mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de maïs, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. Léocadie s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo (Etat voisin du Bénin) et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Léocadie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. La clientèle de Léocadie s’accroît au jour le jour ; mais Léocadie n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. Léocadie sollicite donc un cinquième  crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Born on March 3, 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, G. Léocadie K. is married to Simon LOKO. The couple have four children, all attending school. The family lives in the Ahouassa neighbourhood of Cotonou. Léocadie often assists her husband with household expenses, thanks to the revenue generated by her activity. She attended school up to secondary level. To meet her various expenses over the past eight years, Léocadie has been selling children’s clothing and pieces of fabric, through the distribution system. As a secondary activity Léocadie sells corn, which allows her to diversify her sources of income. She gets her supplies from Lomé in Togo (a neighbouring country), and also from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Léocadie is a former beneficiary of ALIDé, having already been granted four loans, all reimbursed in full. Léocadie’s customer base is increasing day by day, but she is unable to satisfy the demand due to her financial limitations. She is therefore requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing and pieces of fabric

loans.name: Chori

texts.ru: Хакимов Чори проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Хакимов Чори имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Бухгалтер". В области животноводства работает более 10 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Целью кредита является закуп крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Chori H. lives in the Jilikul district. He is 48 years old, married and has 3 children. Chori has a secondary technical education as an accountant. He has been working in the animal husbandry field for over 10 years. He raises and sells livestock. The goal of this loan is a purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Teresita is widowed and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business of buying and selling food supplements and beauty products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $185 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ana Eriselda

texts.es: Ana Eriselda A. R. de 43 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 14 años, el cual estudia educación básica. Ana posee un taller de corte y confección, en el cual se encargar de elaborar prendas de vestir para mujeres hombres y niños. A lo largo de los años Ana ha ido mejorando su trabajo, y obteniendo mayores reconocimientos de las personas, ya que estas piensan que Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre se encuentra frente a su máquina de coser dispuesta a hacerlo lo mejor posible, y entregando todos los pedidos a tiempo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales como telas, hilos y agujas, de manera que cuente con mayor cantidad de productos para la elaboración de la ropa la cual se vende mucho más en estos meses del año, ya que los niños empiezan su año escolar, para Ana su hijo es lo más importante, es por esto que trabaja mucho para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana Eriselda A. R. de 43 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 14 años, el cual estudia educación básica. Ana posee un taller de corte y confección, en el cual se encargar de elaborar prendas de vestir para mujeres hombres y niños. A lo largo de los años Ana ha ido mejorando su trabajo, y obteniendo mayores reconocimientos de las personas, ya que estas piensan que Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre se encuentra frente a su máquina de coser dispuesta a hacerlo lo mejor posible, y entregando todos los pedidos a tiempo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales como telas, hilos y agujas, de manera que cuente con mayor cantidad de productos para la elaboración de la ropa la cual se vende mucho más en estos meses del año, ya que los niños empiezan su año escolar, para Ana su hijo es lo más importante, es por esto que trabaja mucho para seguir adelante.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de telas, hilos y agujas.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan city. She is 43 years old. Erlinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business of making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging n business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa L., 20 years old is engaged in rice farming.  She and her husband are childless. Elisa works very hard on the farm to be able to raise enough money for their daily needs. They hope that someday they will be able to have a baby. Elisa also hopes for an abundant harvest in the farm. She would like to apply for a loan of hp 6,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M., who is 46 years old, lives in Veruela Agusan Del Sur. She makes her livelihood through rice farming. She works from early morning to late in the afternoon in order to monitor her crops to ensure an abundant harvest. 

Myrna has three children. Her eldest is 22 years old and was not able to go to school. She would like to expand her business to support the educational needs of her children. 

She hopes to receive a loan of 6,000 PHP through the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio D. is from the village of Luinab, Iliga City. He is 51 years old. Melecio is married and has ten school-aged children. To make a living, Melecio owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Melecio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Melecio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Melecio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering

location.town: Luinab, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mrs. Deth Hak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who are all living in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Deth H. is the village bank president who was selected by the members. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Deth H. is 38 years old and she is a grocer. Since her business is going well she wants expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Yuthy Voan You, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate. Mrs. Deth H. is the mother of three children who all are students in the local school. 

All the members are shown in the photo, but some of their faces are blocked.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to re-sell.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both of her children attend a local secondary school. 

With the help of her husband, Altantuya manages a meat-trading business in her town. She sells a variety of locally raised meats to her many customers. She started her business in 2003 with capital of 500,000 MNT and has built a successful operation over the years. She travels between Erdenet and Ulaanbaatar cities to sell her products. 

Today, her business continues to grow quickly and she has a large base of loyal customers. Her working capital now exceeds 1,070,000 MNT.  Altantuya is a hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good accounting skills. For the future she says, “I hope to soon expand my business.” She is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase meat to sell in her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Deysi Concepción

texts.es: Deysi Concepción C. C. de 31 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada, así mismo junto a su único hijo de 7 años de edad quien es estudiante. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos alimenticios, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas y otros más. Durante todo un año Deysi ha trabajado mucho por mejorar las ventas de su negocio, y a pesar que cuenta con poco tiempo de poseerlo, está muy bien establecida con la tienda, es gran parte gracias a sus buenas relaciones con sus vecinos quienes la aprecian mucho por ser una mujer muy emprendedora y responsable con su familia. Deysi solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, sobre todo bebidas frías, pan, huevos y granos básicos, los cuales son más vendidos y que está segura que generan mayores ganancias. Deysi desea poder brindarle una estabilidad económica a su hijo, de manera que cuente con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Deysi Concepción C. C. is 31 years old and lives in the Soyapango municipality in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband who works in a private company and also with her 7 year-old son, a student. She has a store in which she sells food, detergent, snacks, drinks and other items. For a full year Deysi has worked hard to improve her business´ sales, and because of this hard work her store is now well established despite the fact that she has only had it a short time. Another reason for this success is the good relationship she has with her neighbors who very much appreciate the fact that she is hard working and a very responsible family member. Deysi would like a loan so she can buy a greater amount of products. Above all, she would like to buy more cold drinks, bread, eggs, and basic grains. Since these items sell so well, she is sure to improve her earnings. She would like to provide her son with a more stable economic situation which she says is necessary for a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cold drinks, eggs, bread and basic grains

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: D. Georgette est née le 06 Janvier 1981 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a quatre ans environs que Georgette s’est installée au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou. C’est une célibataire sans enfant. Georgette vit seule et supporte seule ses charges. Georgette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Georgette mène comme activité, la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (plats, bols, glacières), par le système de distribution. Georgette s’approvisionne au Nigéria et parfois au Togo, deux pays limitrophes du Bénin. Georgette mène cette activité depuis cinq ans. Georgette avait obtenu quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Malgré la passion que Georgette a pour son activité, elle ne dispose pas suffisamment de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus. Pour ce fait, Georgette sollicite un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux faire face à ses différentes charges.
texts.en:
Georgette D. was born January 6, 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. About four years ago Georgette settled in Cotonou’s Kpondéhou neighbourhood. She is unmarried without children. Georgette lives alone and supports her own needs. She has not attended school. To meet her daily needs, Georgette sells kitchen utensils (platters, bowls, iceboxes), through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Nigeria and sometimes from Togo, two countries adjacent to Benin. Georgette has been practicing this activity for the past five years. Georgette had been granted four previous loans from ALIDé, all of which were fully reimbursed. Despite Georgette’s passion for her business, she lacks sufficient funds to bring it to fruition and generate more income. For this reason, Georgette is requesting a fifth loan to strengthen her business so she can better deal with her various expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils (platters, bowls, iceboxes)

loans.name: Patricia Jeannette

texts.es: Patricia Jeannette R. V. de 41 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Durante nueve años Patricia se ha dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzos, así mismo hace platillos típicos como tamales, enchiladas y yuca frita. Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico el cual es el mercado de San Juan Opico, el cual cuenta con gran afluencia de personas durante todo el día, así mismo posee clientes frecuentes los cuales trabajan dentro del mismo mercado y que comercializan productos diferentes. Patricia solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar aceite, arroz, maíz, vegetales y otros productos más los cuales son utilizados para la elaboración de los alimentos. Patricia es una personas que ha sabido salir adelante por sí misma, esforzándose mucho por brindarles todo lo que sus hijos necesita, debido a  que patricia es madre soltera, se siente con el reto de ser mejor cada día y buscar la forma de optimizar su negocio, para que jamás le haga falta nada a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Patricia Jeannette R. V., 41, lives in San Juan Opico, La Libertad department, with her three minor children, who are in school. For the last 9 years, Patricia has sold prepared, typical meals, such as: tamales, enchiladas and fried yucca. Her eatery is strategically located in San Juan Opico's market which receives many visitors daily. She also has regular customers who work in the market itself selling different products. Patricia needs financing to buy cooking oil, rice, corn, vegetables, among other ingredients, which are the most used in her meals. Patricia has always known how to get ahead on her own, working hard to provide her children with everything they need, because Patricia is a single mother. She feels challenged daily with being better and finding the way to improve her business so that her little ones will never lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, corn and vegetables.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Elordina

texts.en: Elordina M., who is 44 years old, is a rice grower. She has tilled a small parcel of land since 2004. Now, she continues planting rice to be able to provide the daily needs of her family. Currently, her farm is doing very well, but she needs additional capital to augment her income. She needs a loan to buy farming necessities. She hopes to receive a loan of 6,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., for fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Carlota Elizabeth

texts.es: Carlota Elizabeth A. C. de 28 años de edad, posee ya dos años de tener su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, que está ubicada en su casa de habitación en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el que vive junto a su familia la cual está conformada por su esposo y dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, quienes asisten a la escuela del lugar. Carlota solicita un préstamo con la ilusión de ver crecer su negocio, comprando productos como pan, huevos, granos básicos y mayor cantidad de sodas, las cuales son las que más se venden. Una tienda es un negocio muy rentable el que permite tener muy buenas ganancias siempre y cuando se cuente con una tienda muy surtida, es por esto que ella espera poder comprar toda la cantidad necesaria de mercadería la cual le permita aumentar sus ventas. Carlota siempre ha soñado poder darles una vida mejor a sus hijos de la que ella tuvo, razón más que suficiente para trabajar arduamente cada día por mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlota Elizabeth A. C., 28, has had her grocery store for two years now. She stocks food and basic needs items in a space in her home, located in Lourdes Colón, La Libertad department. She lives there with her family, which is made up of her husband and two children, 9 and 4 years old, who are enrolled in the local elementary school. Carlota requests funds hoping to help her business grow. She will buy items like: bread, eggs, basic grains, larger amounts of soft-drinks (which are her best sellers). A grocery store is a very profitable business and she always makes good profits, as long as she is well stocked. She hopes, therefore, to be able to buy all the necessary merchandise that will allow her to increase her sales. Carlota has always dreamt of providing for her children a better life than the one she had; sufficient reason to work very hard every day to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lester

texts.en:
Lester V., from the village of Roxas, Avenue Iligan City, is 25 years old, single, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lester owns and operates a business selling flowers in the local community. Engaged in his business for over five years, he earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lester is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand the business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda G., 47 years old, is managing a small rice field in Veruela, Agusan del Sur. A mother of seven children, Rosalinda desires an abundant life which is why she is working very hard to manage her business well and augment the family income. She really enjoys her livelihood and believes that through the purchase of farming necessities such as fertilizers, she will have a greater chance of obtaining a better crop yield. Rosalinda is therefore applying for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. for this purpose.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla B., 53 years old, started to manage a rice farm in 1979. Now she is still pursuing this business because it helps her family a lot in buying the daily needs in their home.

Luzvilla is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

Luzvilla chooses CEVI because aside from loans, she receives insurance coverage from CEVI as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline G., 44 years old, owns and manages a small rice farm, growing and selling rice in her community. The income that she makes from her business is what she uses to supply her family with food, clothes and other basic needs.

Evangeline hopes to receive a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es: Flor Del Carmen C. G. de 50 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo de 68 años de edad. Flor posee una tienda en la cual se venden productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad, así mismo posee una tortillería, negocio en el cual vende tortillas todos los días, razón por la cual obtiene ganancias diarias. Debido a que su esposo es jubilado, tanto Flor como él dependen en gran manera de estos negocios, y es así como se dividen el trabajo, mientras flor hace las tortillas, su esposo está atendiendo la tienda, de esta manera trabajan en conjunto, animándose uno con el otro a seguir adelante y a esforzarse para poder contar con una vejez digna y tranquila en la que no les haga falta nada. Es por esto que Flor solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos perecederos, así mismo comprar maíz al mayoreo para obtenerlos a menores precios, lo cual generará mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Flor Del Carmen C. G. is 50 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, Department of La Libertad with her husband, who is 68 years old. Flor has a store in which she sells food and basic needs products. She also has a tortilla shop in which she sells tortillas every day, allowing her to make a daily profit. Since her husband is retired, he and Flor rely heavily on these businesses. And this is how they divide the work: while Flor makes the tortillas, her husband minds the store. They work together, in this way, encouraging each other to carry on and to put forth the necessary effort to ensure a proud and tranquil old age that lacks nothing. For this reason, Flor is requesting a loan. Through the loan she will be able to purchase larger quantities of perishable goods and wholesale corn at lower prices, which will give her a larger profit.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr: I. Latifatou est née en 1975 à Abéokouta au Nigéria. Latifatou réside depuis une dizaine d’année au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADELOU Soulé, un commerçant, Latifatou est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Latifatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Latifatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs 8 ans, Latifatou mène comme activité, la vente de tissus de façon ambulante à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qu’elle utilise pour faire face à ses différentes charges. C’est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Latifatou s’approvisionne. Latifatou a déjà bénéficié de ALIDé, trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Actuellement Latifatou éprouve des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits. C'est la raison pour laquelle Latifatou sollicite un quatrième prêt afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d’élargir son champ d’activité.
texts.en:
Latifatou I. was born in 1975 at Abeokouta, Nigeria. For the past 10 years Latifatou has lived in the Ayetawadja neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Latifatou is the mother of 3 school aged children and married to Soule Adelou, a businessman. Latifatou lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple meet the needs of the family. Latifatou did not attended school. When she was about 8 years old, Latifatou started to sell fabrics by hawking in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. With this business she earned income which she used to meet her various responsibilities. Latifatou buys her provisions in Lome, Togo, a country neighboring on Benin. Latifatou has already benefited from 3 loans made with ALIDe and these have been duly repaid. Latifatou has recently been experiencing difficulty in acquiring her provisions. For this reason Latifatou has requested this, her fourth loan, to satisfy her customers demands and increase the scope of her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de pièces de tissus.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Mr. Diep M., age 47, is married to Vanny, age 46. They are parents of four children who go to school. Diep M. works as a policeman for a ministry. His wife sells a few grocery items from their home. 

This family has been facing difficulties with transportation for a long time because they do not have a vehicle for traveling needs. Diep M. is happy to apply for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. With the money ($500), he will buy an old motorbike that he will use to commute to his workplace or anywhere else. 

Note: Mr. Diep M. was not available for a photograph, so his wife appears in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy an old motorbike.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna P., 46 years old, owns a small rice farm. A mother of seven children, her eldest child, 26, helps her grow rice. The income that her family makes from this enterprise really helps pay the daily expenses in their home. Because she desires a good life, Myra is doing the very best she can to maximize the harvest and earn a better income. A farmer for many years now, she hopes to make her business more prosperous and buy another farm in the future. Myrna is now requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. which she will use to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M., is already 64 years old but still works on her farm to earn an income. She grows rice. Her husband also tills the farm. Both of them are happy working together because the income they make in their rice farm will pay for the needs of their children, though most of them are already married.

Rosita would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Edenlie

texts.en:
Edenlie A., 23 years old, is a farmer and the mother of three children. She lives in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur, an agricultural community in Mindanao, Philippines.

Edenlie desires a better life for her family and works so hard to be able to raise money to buy her family food, clothing and other basic needs.

Edenlie would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Edelburga

texts.en: Edelburga L. is from the village of Zone3, Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 50 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Edelburga owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Edelburga joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Edelburga is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 3, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela C. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 41 years old, is widowed, and has five school-aged children. Estela owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Estela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Estela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas P., 59 years old, is a rice grower from Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. Despite her age, she is still active and very capable of managing her business. She has workers on the farm and she monitors her harvest all the time.

Leonidas desires to have more income to support her family needs. She likes to grow her income and that is why she would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Teddie

texts.en:
Teddie T., 60 years old, has two children and her eldest child is only four years old.

Teddie told CEVI that farming is her only source of livelihood. Ever since she was a little girl, her parents were farmers and everything she learned about growing plants came from them.

Teddie would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Каюмова Жумагул проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Каюмова Жумагул животноводством занимается более 20 лет. Она откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. В этом ей помогает муж. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Jumagul K. lives in the J. Rumy district. She is 47 years old, married and has 2 children. Jumagul has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years. She raises and sells cattle. Her husband helps her with this business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cyrielle

texts.fr: Née le 18 Mars 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, G. Cyrielle vit depuis environs 25 ans au quartier Dédokpo à Cotonou. Cyrielle est une jeune divorcée ayant un enfant à charge et qui est scolarisé. Cyrielle vit seule avec son enfant et assure les charges de son enfant. Cyrielle n’a fait que l’école primaire. Il y a quatre ans environs, Cyrielle a commencé la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, plats, bols, sceaux et paniers en plastique) par le système de distribution. Cette activité génère des revenus que Cyrielle utilise pour assurer l’entretien et l’éducation de son enfant. Cyrielle achète ses produits au Nigéria et au Togo, deux pays limitrophes du Bénin. Cyrielle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Cyrielle ambitionne renforcer son capital et agrandir son étalage ; ce qui lui permettra de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Cyrielle sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on 18th March 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Cyrielle G. has lived for around 25 years in the Dédokpo neighborhood of Cotonou. She is a young divorced woman with one child in her care, who is at school. Cyrielle lives alone with her child and covers the child's expenses. Cyrielle has only been to primary school. About four years ago she started selling kitchenware (ice-boxes, plates, bowls, seals and plastic washing baskets) through the distribution system. This activity generates income that Cyrielle uses to cover the upkeep and education of her child. Cyrielle buys her products in Nigeria and Togo, two countries which border Bénin. She is an old client of ALIDé who repays her loans without problem. Much in demand from her customers, Cyrielle's ambition is to strengthen her capital and expand her display of goods; this will allow her to meet the ever rising demand. It is the reason for which she is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ice-boxes, bowls, sets of plates and plastic washing bowls

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en: Restituta L. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Restituta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling food supplements and personal products like soap, lotion, and more in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Restituta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Restituta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Soeu N. is a low-income person earning a living as a grocery seller in Kampong Chhnang province. She is married with six children, two of whom are married while the remaining four are single. To help feed the family, two of her daughters sew clothes for a garment industry. Her husband is a contributor who assists the family by cultivating rice. Soeu N. is very busy in her business due to there being many clients who need her items, and recently part of her inventory has been exhausted. She hopes to acquire other items by asking for a loan to increase the different types of groceries she sells. (Soeu N. was very busy selling her items when the photo was taken so her husband is shown instead.)

loans.use: To increase the different types of groceries she sells

loans.name: Julie's Group

texts.en: Julie A. is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Julie is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Julie is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Julie operates a store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Julie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Julie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Julie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

texts.en: Narcisa E. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Narcisa owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia V. is from the village of Z3, Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 53 years old. Virginia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Virginia operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of dry goods in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. loans.name: Mrs. Yee Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village-bank loan consists of 15 people who live in Kbal Kaoh village in the Kandal province. Mrs. Yee S. is the village-bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Sorn OUn, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field for cultivating rice and vegetables. 

On their farm, they face a problem because their field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Yee S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support their crops. She is 36 years old and the mother of seven children. One of her children is employed in the garment factory, another is a laborer, three are attending the local school and the remaining children are too young to work or study. 

Mrs. Khom B. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: F. Micheline

texts.fr: F. F. Micheline est née le 20 Juin 1985 à Abomey-Calavi au Bénin. Il y a 6 ans que Micheline vit à Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Micheline n’est pas encore mariée et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Micheline vit donc seule et supporte seule ses charges, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Micheline excelle dans la commercialisation des produits vivriers, surtout le haricot, au marché DANTOKPA, marché international du Bénin. C’est à Ikpinlè et à Kétou, deux marchés de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin, que Micheline  s’approvisionne. Micheline  a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans ce domaine, mais n’avait jamais eu de prêt à ALIDé. Très sollicitée par les détaillants des petits marchés de la ville, et par ses autres clients, Micheline ambitionne agrandir son étalage afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Micheline sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
F. F. Micheline was born on June 20, 1985 in Abomey-Calavi in Bénin. For 6 years, Micheline has been living in Hlacomey in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Micheline is not yet married and has no children as yet. She lives alone and supports herself thanks to income from her business.

Micheline excels in selling foodstuffs, especially dried beans, at the Dantokpa market, the international market of Bénin. She gets her inventory in Ikpinlè and Kétou, two foodstuffs markets in Bénin. She has been in this business for three years already, but has not yet had a loan from ALIDé. Very much in demand among the retailers at the small markets of the town, as well as among her other customers, Micheline dreams of expanding her display so as to keep up with growing demand; this is why she is requesting her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of dried beans

loans.name: Hudaynazar

texts.ru: Мусаев Худайназар проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Мусаев Худайназар имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Продавец". Животноводством занимается более 30 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Hudaynazar M. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 57 years old, married and has 4 children. Hudaynazar has a secondary technical education as a salesperson. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 30 years. He raises and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. is a 24-year-old mother of a two-year-old child and a wife of a 27-year-old construction worker. While she still has only one small child, she wants to invest in growing a business so that by the time her family has grown she will have the finances in place to support it. 

Aside from the food selling business which she had started through her previous loans from ASHI, Gina now wants another loan for an additional business which is pig fattening. 

With this kind of business, Gina can maximize her time at home while taking care of her two-year-old child. After four months of fattening her pig, she can sell it either alive or slaughter it and sell its pork per kilo in the neighborhood. The profit with this is not much but is fair enough. But once a large volume of pigs are fattened and sold at one time, the profit would be as much as double its capital and this is what Gina envisions.

loans.use: Piglets for a pig fattening business

loans.name: Roseler

texts.en:
Roseler S. is from the village of Hinaplanon Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Roseler is single. Roseler owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Roseler has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $107 US) for these activities.

In 2009, Roseler joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Roseler has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Roseler is now requesting her second loan, this one for 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mrs. Top Lach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Top L. lives in Thma Sa village in Takeo province. She is a village bank president for a group that consists of fifteen members who receive individual loans but are bound by a group guarantee, located in Kbal Kaoh village, Kandal province.  She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer while other is a student in the local school.

She and her husband, Mr. Tuy Doang, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate both rice and vegetables. They face a problem because their field is infertile, and is located far from an irrigation system. Therefore, Mrs. Top L. has asked for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to support her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to support farming

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada A. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Amada is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Amada owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Amada has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. 

Amada is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be invested in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Amada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to invest in expanding her food sales business

loans.name: Jordiana

texts.en:
Jordiana A. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Jordiana is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jordiana owns and operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Jordiana has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jordiana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jordiana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. Jordiana is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jordiana from HSPFI. She plans to reinvest the additional revenue generated from the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
