Antoine owns a small shop that sells different kinds of products such as water, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, biscuits (cookies) and so forth. His business is well organized, famous and important for his neighbors, the reasons why he is stimulated to grow his business through purchasing more products to sell. Antoine has been an entrepreneur for nine years and the hours of his business are 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., every day except Sunday.

Antoine is requesting his loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase other new products such as trousers, shirts, bags and so on. With these new products, he hopes to earn more customers because of many requests for these items.

By earning more profits, Antoine will be able to build his own house so that he is able to get married.

loans.use: To purchase other new products such as trousers, shirts, bags and so on

loans.name: Basima

texts.en:
Basima is a 55-year-old widow who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her five children. Basima has been selling women's clothes from her house since 1983. She sells dresses, shirts, sweaters, etc. Basima requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her sales. Basima has been a microcredit client for eight years now, and has always paid on time. 

Basima is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and they feel comfortable purchasing from her. Her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties, since she has a big social network and people know her well. Basima decided to start her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation, especially after she lost her husband; she is a very active woman who does her best to improve her income and provide the best to her family. Therefore, she decided to have independent work. 

In the future, she plans to keep up the good work, and hope one day to expand her business by opening a shop, which will allow her to welcome more clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her sales

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 33 years old and is married with four children, with ages between 3 and 13. She and her family live in Rubavu, in the Western Province of Rwanda, where she sells milk.

This is Odette’s tenth successful year in her business. She employs four people in the business and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Odette, after finding herself unable to satisfy the demands of her customers, decided she needed to request a Kiva loan. The loan will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers as well as allowing her to purchase some new equipment which will be in use during the time she will be selling milk to her customers.

With this loan, Odette’s business will keep growing. She hopes to earn enough profits to help her to pay school fees, to renovate her house and beside that, with the remaining portion of her profits, to reinvest in her business so that her future business will be stable.

Odette has a plan to buy her own house through the profits she earns from her business.

loans.use: To buy a big quantity of milk to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is a 50-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Binicuil Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She is the mother of the cashier at the NWTF-Project Dungganon Kabankalan Branch. She earns her living by running a general store and by selling bananas, charcoal, and rice at retail prices.

Erlinda’s husband Roberto, is 51 years old and drives the truck that came also from Project Dungganon as an asset loan. They have eight children who are between 17 and 32 years old. Two of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores, five have their own families and one is single and works to help support the family.

Erlinda C. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income by selling bananas, charcoal, and rice at retail prices and by running a general store. Now, she earns an average monthly income of Php 60,000 from her business activities.

Erlinda C.  is a Project Dungganon member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 26,000 was used to fund operations of her retail business selling bananas, charcoal, and rice, and her general store. Her business activities had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 17th loan, in the amount of Php 29,500, which she intends to use to restock her general store and to buy bananas, charcoal, and rice that she resells. Erlinda C. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To restock her store

loans.name: Madia's Group

texts.en:
Madia is a 56-year-old divorced woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Madia has been working as a seamstress since 1974. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new and more sophisticated sewing machine and thread for her business. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid her loans on time. 

Madia is special in her work because she is known for her good quality of work and punctuality in repairing clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have any difficulties. Madia decided to continue her business because she likes it and has a lot of experience. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase a new and more sophisticated sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 29 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Zeinab has been working as a seamstress since 2007. She sews all type of clothes, such as men’s suits, women’s dresses, and sweaters. Her work helps her to supplement her family’s income, and allows her to have her own income. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine and thread for her business. This is the first time that Zeinab has requested a loan. 

Zeinab is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues. She decided to start her business because she had been sewing since she was young.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and thread for her business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam P. is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Enclaro, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling nipa (palm leaves that are woven together and used as roofing material for native huts) and operating a fish pond. Meriam’s husband Tirzo helps in running the business, concentrating most of his efforts in the management of the fish pond. They have 5 children who all go to school but, as part of their daily chores, also assist their parents in their business activities. 

Meriam joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope of improving her family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase the family income and now earns an average of Php 10,000 a month from her business activities. She is a member of good standing who used her last loan of Php 29,000 to fund her nipa business. This had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 29,500 (her 18th loan) to continue improving her business. Meriam is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" — a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille was born in 1976 and is married with three children aged between 3 and 15 years. She and her family live in the Western Province of Rwanda, approximately three hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Dancille’s village, called Nyabihu, is where, since 2007, she has owned her business selling women’s clothes. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Although this hardworking businesswoman has been in her business for three years, her profit is still too low to expand the business meaningfully and she believes that a small amount of additional capital would change her business positively.

For that reason, Dancille is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell so that she will be able to satisfy the demands of her customers.

With this loan, Dancille hopes that she will become more efficient, effective and successful. She thanks VFC and Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita M. is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy, Utod Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her pottery business with the help of her husband Jimmy. They have four adult children some of whom are already married with children of their own while the  others help their parents in the business.

Juanita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in the hope of helping her husband improve the family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income through her pottery making and now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,200 from it. She is a member of good standing using her previous loan of Php 10,000 to fund her pottery making. This had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. She is now borrowing her 17th loan (Php 16,000) also to grow the pottery business. Juanita is working hard to achieve her dream for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" — a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 44 years old and is married with seven children with ages 1, 8, 10, 13, 16, 18 and 22 years. Gaspard and his family live in Burera, in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

It is in this area where Gaspard owns a butcher shop. This is his twentieth successful year in the business of selling beef. He employs three people and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day.

Gaspard is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business as well as for buying a cow to sell. With the use of this loan, Gaspard will be able to satisfy the demands of his customers whose number keeps growing day by day.

Through selling meat to a large number of customers, Gaspard will continue to pay school fees for his children as well as saving for them so that he will be able to pay for their university studies as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To expand his business and to buy a cow to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita F. is a 57-year old widow who lives in Brgy, Utod Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by traveling to local markets to sell spices. She has six adult children and six grandchildren. Some of her children help her run the business.

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in the hope of improving her family's quality of life. Before her husband passed away she saw her family gradually raised from poverty. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD for her spice business, she now earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000. She is a member of good standing and is now borrowing Php 29,500 (her 18th loan) for her traveling spice business. Teresita is working hard to achieve her dream for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"— a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: additional capital for business

loans.name: Friendly People Group

texts.en: Garmai H. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Friendly People Group. She is 36 years old and married with four children. Her children range in age from 6 to 19 years and their educational levels are from kindergarten to 9th grade. She did not continue her education after 11th grade due to the outbreak of the Liberian civil crisis in 1990. Garmai and her family live and work in the Bernard Farm community on Kakata Highway, Margibi County, Liberia. Garmai’s business is the sale of general goods such as insecticides, candles, matches, torch lights, etc. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail from a tabletop in front of her house to residents of Bernard Farm. She has been running this business for more than 18 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future. Garmai started selling in neighboring Guinea when she was there as a refugee. She was able to save a little starter capital through doing laundry for Guineans, then got into her general goods sales. When Garmai returned home, she continued doing her business. Garmai talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan to purchase additional general goods for resale. She dreams of giving her children education as a gift and helping them become future leaders. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Garmai is the one holding the sign. Kpana T. is in the lower right inset photo. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP, a Kiva partner, seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional general goods for resale such as insecticides, candles, matches, and torch lights

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline is 37 years old and is married with eight children aged between 2 and 17. She lives in Ruhengeli in the Northern Province of Rwanda, Burera district, which is approximately two hours from Kigali city. This is touristy region where there is a National Park of gorillas.

Jaqueline, before being a businesswoman, was a farmer. However, the more her family kept growing, the more she was unable to get all the basic needs for them. This is the reason why she prefers to be a businesswoman rather than a farmer.

Jaqueline sells foodstuffs such as beans, sorghum, and so on and opens her shop from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day. In this field of business she has two years experience and employs three people from her community as helpers so that her business runs well. 

Jaqueline is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via vision Finance Company in order to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Through selling larger quantities, she hopes to get a good result, which will help her to save money for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Neris Clarisa

texts.es:
Neris V. de 37 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y ladrillos tiene tan solo como servicios básicos agua y luz, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 9, 4 todos estudiando en una escuela fiscal.

Neris comenzó trabajando con su mama, aprendió todo con respecto a la costura, después de un tiempo pudo comprarse una pequeña maquina de coser.

Ahora ella trabaja de lunes a viernes sola desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer confeccionando camisas, pantalones etc. Otra de las actividades que ella hace para tener otro ingreso extra es ser enfermera. Una de las complicaciones que ella tiene es darse tiempo para las dos actividades que realiza.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y otra parte para comprar techo para su casa. En el futuro quiere dedicarse solo a ser modista con un local propio y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Neris V., 37, lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of bricks and cement; its only utilities are water and electricity. She is a single mother of three children, who are 12, 9 and 4 years old; all the children are enrolled in the local public school. Neris began learning everything about clothes making from her mother. Eventually she was able to buy her own sewing machine. Now, she works Monday through Friday, from early in the morning until late at night, sewing shirts, pants, etc. To earn extra income, she also works as a nurse. One of the complications she faces is finding enough time for both activities. She will use part of the funding to buy fabric and part to buy roofing for her house. In the future she would like to be able to just be a seamstress with her own shop and to be able to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and roofing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Stalin Olmedo

texts.es:
Stalin Vázquez de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, cuanta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar con ella tiene 2 hijos, estudiantes de colegios fiscal.

Stalin aprendió ya hace muchos años atrás a ser mecánico trabajando con su papa en el taller que el tenia, poco a poco pudo reunir dinero para independizarse.

Stalin ahora trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00 reparando y dando mantenimientos a los vehículos, un aproximado de la reparación casi total de una vehiculo es de $ 900.00, uno de los inconvenientes que ahora tiene son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, arena para poder construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere hacer adecuaciones en su casa para poder trasladar el taller de reparación.
texts.en:
Stalin Vásques is 41. He lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. The area has all of the basic services. His wife does the household chores, and they have two children. The children go to public schools. Many years ago Stalin learned how to be a mechanic by working with his father in the shop he had. Little by little he was able to get together enough money to become independent. Stalin now works everyday from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. repairing and performing maintenance on vehicles. An almost complete repair of a vehicle costs approximately $900.00. One of the inconveniences he now has is the rains. With the loan he wants to buy cement, rocks, and sand to be able to build his house better. In the future he wants to make adaptations to his house to be able to move his repair shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, rocks, and sand

loans.name: Sandra Katherine

texts.es:
Sandra V. de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo que tiene 1 año.

Sandra empezó con un capital que había estado ahorrando, una vez que tuvo el capital necesario compro unas vitrinas con algunos productos de papelería.

Sandra ahora trabaja todos los días de 08h00 hasta las 20h00, ella vende la resma de hoja a $ 3.5, las plumas a $ 0.15, el pliego de cartulina a $ 0.3. El promedio de clientes que ella atiende diario es de 68 personas. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia del sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hojas, plumas, cartulina y otros artículos para la papelería. En el futuro quiere adecuar mejor su casa para poder trasladar su negocio y así tener más tiempo para su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra V., 32, lives in a periurban zone along Guayaquil's beltway. Her house is cement and has all the basic utilities. She is a single mother of a one-year-old son. Sandra started off with her own savings, which she used to buy some display cases and some stationery supplies. Sandra now works every day from 8am until 8pm. She sells a ream of paper for $3.5, pens at $0.15, a sheet of construction paper at $0.3. She sees about 68 customers per day on average. One of the difficulties she faces is the high crime rate in her area. She will use the funding to buy paper, pens, construction paper and other stationery items. In the future, she would like to equip her house so that she can move her business there in order to have more time with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Writing paper, pens, construction paper.

loans.name: Yeny Fatima

texts.es: Doña Yeni Fatima de 36  años de edad, es casada con el Sr. Santana Luna, habitan en la Comarca Las Pavas del municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes, tiene 6 hijos, el mayor de 16 años, otro de 15 y otro de 14 años, los cuales estudian y ayudan a sus padres a atender la finca, los 3 menores solo estudian; Yeni esta solicitando su 1er credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de comprar terneros para engordarlos y desarrollarlos y asi lograr incrementar los ingresos familiares, para comercializarlos a un mejor precio. Cuenta con el apoyo de su marido quien le ayuda a trabajar la finca y a cuidar el ganado.  Espera contar con el apoyo de kiva para lograr establecer esta compra.  Su mayor sueño es lograr incrementar su hato ganadero para obtener mejores ganancias, pues es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Yeni Fatima, 36, is married to Santana Luna. They live in the Las Pavas region of the Muelle de los Bueyes municipality. They have six children. The oldest is 16, the next is 15, and the other one is 14. They go to school and help their parents take care of the farm. The three younger ones only go to school. Yeni is asking for her first loan with AFODENIC to buy calves to fatten and raise. She will then sell them for a better price and increase the family income. She has her husband’s support; he works on the farm and takes care of the livestock. She hopes to have Kiva’s support to be able to make this purchase. Her greatest dream is to increase her herd of cattle to get greater earnings. It is the family’s main asset.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Franklin Alberto

texts.es:
Franklin Alberto M. S. es un joven de 24 años de edad quien vive con su mamá y sus dos hermanos en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Franklin esta a cargo de la mayoría de gastos en su casa, para cubrirlos se ha dedicado a la siembra de piña, comenta que fueron sus tíos los que le dieron la oportunidad de iniciar en este negocio, por lo que dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo comenta que este proyecto  le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Franklin es un micro crédito de ¢657,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y siete mil colones), para comprar hijos de piña, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Franklin es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Franklin Alberto M. S., 24, lives with his mother and two younger siblings in a small community called La Trinchera de Pital, which is in Alajuela province. Its main productive activities are farming and cattle-raising. The main crop is pineapple, which is primarily exported. For this reason, the community has been growing in the last few years, thereby creating greater demand for its products as well as more employment opportunities. Most of the household expenses are Franklin’s responsibility. In order to meet them, he has gone into pineapple farming. He tells us that his uncles eased him into this line of work so he has quite a bit of experience in pineapple growing. He also tells us that the project has had good results at sales time so he would like to enlarge his fields because, thanks to this work, his family’s quality of life has improved considerably. Franklin is asking for 657,000 colones to buy rows of pineapple, as well as other needed supplies to maintain and care for his crops, so that his efforts will be rewarded with a bountiful harvest. Franklin is a member of the Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital communal bank, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes it will help him continue to grow personally and economically and to participate actively in his community’s credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for pineapple farming.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man with one young child. He has been involved in the construction sector for the past ten years.

In 2006, Ali decided to work on his own and take on home projects. He started with small projects and he's very thankful for the results. He has been able to meet his family’s needs and to raise his baby.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy steel stands specialized for the construction business because he’s planning to take on bigger projects and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy steel stands for his business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings.

In 2007, Hasan opened a small shop to sell music, movie discs and tapes and some gadgets. His small business allowed him to provide better living conditions and to ameliorate his living situation.

Today, Hasan is requesting $1,000 to buy more merchandise and to make some modifications and renovations to his shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and make some modifications and renovations to his shop

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
La señora C. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, ella va a utilizar el crédito para surtir su negocio.
Ella quiere comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, 1000 rajas de leña, golosinas, etc. Su negocio comenzó cuando muy joven vivía en Masaya y tenía una tienda de ropa,  después vendió su casa en Masaya y se vino a vivir al viejo donde puso la pulpería que es ahora la que le da su alimentación diaria. 
Doña Meris es una señora de 63 Años, acompañada no tiene hijos, solo vive con su marido.
Este es el crédito No. 23 que tiene con CEPRODEL los cuales todos los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma y ella dijo que sus créditos con CEPRODEL le han ayudado a crecer en su negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Señora C. has a grocery store in her home; she will use this loan to stock her store. She needs to buy rice, beans, sugar, 1000 pieces of firewood, sweets, etc. Her business started when she was young living in Masaya and she had a clothing shop. Later she sold her house in Masaya and came to live in El Viejo where she put the shop that now provides her daily bread. Doña Meris is a lady of 63, without children, living only with her husband. This is Loan #23 that she has through CEPRODEL, all of which have been repaid in good time with no problems, and she says that her loans through CEPRODEL have helped her to increase her business and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is a 36 year old woman who lives with her husband and son in Goicochea, San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Her highest level of formal education is the completion of 3rd grade.

The loan consultant that has been working with Erika has described her as a hardworking, honest, sincere, noble woman with a battling spirit. This will be her first loan with Fundacion Mujer. Erika is applying for this loan in an effort to gain financial independence as well as to earn an income to help her sister Karol raise her child, who has special needs.

Erika's determination is exemplified by her daily work routine. She has dedicated the last five years of her life to selling newspapers in the morning while working as a masseuse in the afternoon. Recently, an opportunity to purchase the newspaper stand and license where Erika and her sister work, has presented itself. Erika plans to use this loan to purchase the newspaper vendors license from the Costa Rican government, for 250,000 colons, and also the newsstand itself.

As owner, Erika will be able to earn more revenues and better support herself, her immediate family and her sister. The newspaper stand is located diagonally to the Legislative Assembly in a densely populated pedestrian zone of San Jose where many locals have become accustomed to purchasing their daily newspapers.

Erika and her sister sell papers from 6 a.m. to noon everyday or until they run out of papers. In an average good month Erika can earn 290,000 colons selling papers.


Erika’s goals are to earn enough money from the newsstand to provide a quality standard of living for her family. In the long term she would like to open a beauty salon.

Although she would like to be able to sell more than just newspapers at her stand, this would require the purchase of another expensive license. Erika mentions this as one of the main deterrents to the growth of her business. The good news is that her papers are selling fast, and often she is sold out by 8 in the morning!

loans.use: To purchase a newspaper vendor's licence and stand

loans.name: Jaime Wilder

texts.es: El Sr. Jaime R. Q. tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Santiago – Ica junto a su esposa la Sra. María Pacheco Cartagena y sus 2 hijos menores en edad escolar. Cliente realiza la actividad de maestro contructor  en diversas obras de la zona de Santiago desde hace 6 años aproximadamente. También realiza la actividad de estibador para una empresa distribuidora de algodón por campañas correspondientes a la cosecha de algodón en los meses de enero a junio. Su esposa labora como obrera de campo en diferentes parcelas agricolas. No tienen endeudamiento con ninguna institución. Cuentan con buena acumulación de bienes. Actualmente está construyendo en su casa un módulo de vivienda para damnificados del terremoto por lo cual requiere de préstamo para solventar gastos de mano de obra y concluir con construcción de dicho módulo. Son personas muy trabajadoras las cuales brindan educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretenden tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime R. Q. is 44 and in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own home in the Santiago-Ica District with his wife, Mrs. Maria Pacheco Cartagena and their 2 school-aged children. This client has been a master contractor in different jobs in the Santiago area for approximately 6 years. He also works in a warehouse for a cotton distribution company during their season in the months of January-June. His wife does farm work in the countryside. They have no debts with any institution and they have a good asset base. Currently they are building a room on their house for people displaced by the earthquake. For this they need a loan to take care of the expenses for labor and to finish the construction of the room. They are very hard-working and with much effort, they are able to educate their children and improve their quality of life. Their dream is to finish the construction of their home. They both are grateful for the assistance offered to help them fulfill their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve their home

loans.name: Aydalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Aydalina B. trabaja en la alcaldía municipal tiene dos años para elaborar para esta institución de conserje,  solicita el crédito para completar la compra de materiales como arena, cemento y hierro para hacer un cuarto a unos de sus bebe. Es el Segundo Crédito  con Ceprodel lo cual  le va a ayudar mucho ya que solo así  podría terminar la construcción de su cuarto por que tiene un salario muy bajo.
Tiene un hijo en edad escolar, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en el minsa (centro de salud)
texts.en:
Senora Aydalina has worked for the municipal mayor's office for 2 years for the custodial department. She is requesting a loan to complete the purchase of materials such as sand, cement and iron to build a room for a baby. This is her second loan through Ceprodel, it will greatly help her as this is the only way she will be able to complete the construction of her room since she has a small salary. She has one school-age son, she is married and her husband works in El Minsa Health Center.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Oumou

texts.en:
Ms. Oumou S., aged 57, has been a commercante (trader or vendor) for thirty years.  Since joining U-IMCEC in 2008, she has financed her small business with three loans.

In her thirty years of business she has sold a diverse array of products, traveling to neighboring Gambia and Mali to procure fabrics and other wares.  With her fourth loan, she will purchase a special incense produced in the holy city of Mecca.  As 95% of Senegalese are Muslims, the incense is in high demand.  She will cut the large blocks of incense into smaller pieces to sell for religious ceremonies.

Ms. S. is married and has four adult children.  She takes care of a grandchild while her mother works abroad.

loans.use: Buying incense

loans.name: Peddlers Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Peddlers' group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. Members of the 'Peddlers' group are small-scale entrepreneurs who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, sales and sales-to-profit-margin will also improve. As a result, their standard of living will improve – they will be in better positions to look after themselves and their children in terms of their educational, nutritional and medical needs.

Alfred T., who is second from right, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alfred is a 32-year-old father of 4 children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending schools – 2 in class 5, 1 in class 2 and 1 in class 1. Alfred has been selling medicines for over 10 years now. With this loan, Alfred will buy medicines such as paracetamol and chloroquine.

loans.use: Buy medicines such as paracetamol and chloroquine

loans.name: Eulalio Noel

texts.es:
El Sr. V. T. tiene un taller de electricidad automotriz en su casa de habitación, el va a ocupar este dinero en la compra de materiales que le hacen falta para su trabajo.

El quiere comprar una caja de herramientas que contenga copas de diferentes medidas y tamaños y de todo tipo de llaves, Su taller  comenzó de muy joven cuando él trabajaba con un señor, fue entonces donde él aprendió, lo que hoy en día le trae el sustento a su hogar. 

El espera con este crédito poder comprar todos los materiales necesarios para así poder hacer sus trabajos de una forma más rápida y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señor V. T. has an automotive electrical shop in his home. He will use this money to purchase materials he needs for his work. He will buy a toolbox containing sockets of various measurements and sizes and with all types of wrenches. He started his shop very young when he worked for a gentleman, where he learned what now supports him. He hopes, with this loan, to be able to buy all the things necessary to do his work faster and be able to earn more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for his work: 2 solder guns, a grindstone,  a set of wrenches

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS EMPRENDEDORES” de la Asociación Arariwa y esta compuesto de once socios. Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúnen cada treinta días en la oficina del socio Favio. 

Nuestros socios en su mayoría trabajan como empleados de la empresa privada “Erusal” y también tiene pequeños negocios como por ejemplo venta de comida, abarrotes y cosméticos.  La socia Sonia es empleada del hogar en el domicilio de la socia Maruja. La socia Karina es una mujer joven que tiene 25 años y es natural de la ciudad de Oropesa. Karina ofrece a sus amigas, amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo productos de belleza como aretes, pulseras, anillos, perfumes, colonias y pinta labios. La socia Karina requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank “LOS EMPRENDEDORES” in the Arariwa Association, consisting of 11 members. They live in the city of Cusco and meet once a month in the office of one of the members, Favio. Our members mostly work as employees of the private firm "Erusal" and also have small businesses such as selling meals, groceries, or cosmetics. Sonia is a household employee in the home of another member, Maruja. Karina is a young woman of 25, a citizen of the city of Oropesa. Karina offers beauty products such as earrings, bracelets, rings, perfumes, colognes, and lipsticks to her friends, family members, and workmates. Karina needs this loan to buy beauty products such as perfumes. The members appreciate and are grateful for the award of this loan and commit themselves to complete the payments according to the agreed schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: One member will purchase beauty products such as perfumes

loans.name: Sabenty Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Sabenty Enterprise' group from the northern city of Makeni in Sierra Leone. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, earn more profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of borrowers is Zainab K., in the middle of the photo. The 35-year-old is married to a driver and they have 3 children – 2 in primary school and one in secondary school. For 2 years now, Zainab has been selling firewood. With her share of this loan, she will buy more firewood to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy firewood to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Yanis

texts.es: El Sr. Yanis P. trabaja en Cemex cementera (elaboración del cemento) ubicada aquí en el municipio de san Rafael del sur es operador de hornos tiene 20 años para trabajar a esta institución. Ya ha tenido 8 créditos con Ceprodel lo cual me ha  impactado muchísimo porque ha sido una gran ayuda para mi poder mejorar mi casita y comprar electrodomésticos para mi esposa, también he  podido ayudarme en  los estudio de mi hija que está en la universidad. Estoy casado tengo una familia de 3 hijos uno en la universidad y uno en primaria, mi esposa es ama de casa.
texts.en:
Señor Yanis P. works in the Cemex cement plant (manufacturing cement) located here in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. He has been working at this institution for 20 years operating the ovens. He has already had 8 loans through Ceprodel that "have had a big impact on me by helping me improve my house and buy electric appliances for my wife. They have also helped my daughter to study at the university. I am married with 3 children, one at university and one in primary school. My wife is the soul of our home."

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, and cement blocks.

loans.name: Astou Mbene

texts.fr:
Madame Astou Mbène F. est une commerçante de divers produits dans la ville de Thiès, située à 70 Kms de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Elle a embrassé ce secteur depuis plus de 5 ans.  Elle achète des produits de mer  (guédia, yett, touffa, paagn, yohoss) et de l’huile de palme qu’elle place à ses clients  jusqu’à la fin du mois.  Elle est  à sa troisième demande de crédit  afin de s’approvisionner auprès de son fournisseur. Elle demande un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour financier son activité. Ce crédit lui permettra d’épargner ses profits pour les imprévus ou les charges quotidiennes et d’assurer régulièrement sa cotisation dans la tontine de son coin où il est membre depuis longtemps.

Mariée il y’a longtemps, Madame Astou Mbène F. n’a pas pu avoir d’enfants avec son mari polygame. C’est ainsi qu’elle a senti  la nécessité d’adopter la fille de son frère âgée de 5 ans. En fait, elle est la deuxième épouse et vit dans la maison de ses parents.
texts.en:
Mrs. Astou Mbène F. is a shopkeeper of various products in the city of Thiès, located 70 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She has embraced this sector for the past 5 years. She buys her sea products (dried fish, dried mollusk, touffa, paagn, yohoss) and palm oil that she provides to her clients until the end of the month. She is requesting her third loan to get provisions from her supplier. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 CFA to finance her business. This loan will allow her to save her profits for unforeseen or daily expenses and guarantee regular contributions to the local savings group that she has been a member of for a long time. Married long ago, Mrs. Astou Mbène F. was unable to have children with her polygamous husband. Thus, she felt the need to adopt her brother's five-year old daughter. She is the second spouse and lives in her parents' home.

Translated from French by Owen Frivold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seafood Purchase

loans.name: Gloria María Méndez Laínez

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria Maria M. tiene una pulpería en su casa ella realiza las compra en Managua el mercado oriental y también tiene una venta de ropa usada en el mercado municipal ella compra las pacas en Managua y la vende aquí en su tramo en el mercado, el crédito lo solicita para compra mas mercadería como arroz, azúcar, frijoles aceite para surtir su pulpería  y ropa escolar . Este negocio surgió de cuando ella cambio de domicilio y vio la necesidad que había en poner una pulpería ahí en ese lugar ya que no había y también para no estar ella sin hacer nada ha tenido cuatro créditos con Ceprodel y le han impactado muchísimo ya que a podido incrementar sus ingresos tiene tres hijas una ya esta graduada y trabaja y las otra dos estudian en la universidad.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria M. has a small general store in her home. She buys her products in Managua at the Asian market. She also has a used clothing stand at the municipal market. She buys her stock in Managua and sells it from her stall in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her store, such as rice, sugar, beans, oil and school clothing. Her business arose when she moved to a new house, and she saw the need for a general store in the neighborhood, since there was none in the area; she also wanted to have something productive to do. She has had four loans with Ceprodel, and they have had a great impact on her life, allowing her to increase her income. She has three daughters; one has already graduated and is working, and the other two are studying at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, cooking oil and school clothing such as white shirts

loans.name: Mohamed L.'s Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers is made up of teachers, cleaners and security guards in one of the secondary schools in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Forty-seven-year-old Mohamed L. K. (first from left) is the leader of this group. He is a teacher at the school and has been in the teaching profession for 7 years now. Born in Kambia district in northern Sierra Leone, Mohamed is married with 1 child who is in class II. Mohamed wants to pursue further studies, thus with his share of the loan, he will pay college fees for himself. 

(Attached are snapshots of group members who were not present during disbursement.)

loans.use: Pay school fees for himself

loans.name: Inelda

texts.es: La Sra. Inelda E. es profesora de secundaria trabaja en el colegio los E. ubicado en san pablo  ella tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel solicita el crédito para compra de materiales de construcción arena cemento y mano de obra, para ampliar su casa,  es casada tiene tres hijos todos en edad escolar, este aumento lo necesita hacer ya que su casa es muy pequeña y los niños han crecido y necesitan tener su propia privacidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Inelda E. is a high school teacher in the E. High School located in San Pablo. She has been working with Ceprodel for four years. She is requesting a loan to pay for construction materials like sand and cement, and for labor in order to enlarge her home. She is married and has three school-aged children. This expansion is necessary since her house is very small and her children have grown and need to have their own privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sand, cement blocks, and pay for labor

loans.name: Bolívar

texts.es:
Bolívar F. S., tiene la edad de 53 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 18,14, 10 y 4 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para Compra de inventario para el negocio de abarrotes.El desea darle el mantenimiento adecuado a su negocio para que sus ventas aumenten y por ende aumentar sus ingresos económicos, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería que lo creó hace aproximadamdente dos años. El desea surtir su pulpería con con la compra de mercadería  de la canasta básica sobre todo.
No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron, porque esto le ha ayudado a que su negocio crezca.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos y esposa una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Bolívar F. S., 53, is married and has 4 children, who are his first priority in life. His children are 18, 14, 10, and 4 years old, respectively. He needs funding to buy stock items for his grocery store. He wants to stock his store well-enough so that his sales will increase thereby increasing his income. His business is a small grocery store that he created about two years ago. He wants to stock it primarily with merchandise that is typical of the “canasta basica” (Traditionally, canasta basica has represented the minimum food and household items required for a family over a one-month period). This isn’t his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms granted because this has been of great help for his business’ growth. He hopes in the future to provide his wife and children with a better quality of life and improved economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramiro es un cliente nuevo, casado tiene 3 hijos, volvió al país hace 1 año y medio de la Argentina fue en busca de mejores días para el  como para su familia, regreso con la experiencia de haber trabajado dentro del rubro de la confección , aprendió mucho , experiencia que se trajo de allá, hoy en dia cuenta con su propio taller donde tiene cuatro maquinas, dando empleo a otras personas.
No le fue muy bien en el país  extranjero porque no le pagaban como debía de ser por eso decidió volver de allá, hoy por hoy se encuentra ya en el mercado ganando clientes poco a poco, aun no es muy conocido su taller pero esta en proyección para crecer. 

Sus sueños son crecer en el mercado teniendo  mejores condiciones para afrontar a la competencia y ser muy reconocido segundo comprarse una casa y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. En un futuro estará incursionando en el mercado de las fronteras como  Brasil y Argentina.

El destino del credito es para comprarse una nueva maquina de coser.

Esta agradecido con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la ororgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a new client. He is married and has three children. He returned to the country a year and a half ago from Argentina. He went looking for better days for himself and his family. He returned with the experience of having worked within the field of sewing. He learned a lot, and he brought his experience back with him. He now has his own shop with four machines, and he provides employment for other people. It was not very good for him in the foreign country because they did not pay them as they should have. That is why he decided to return from there. For the time being you can find him at the market winning customers little by little. His shop is not very well known yet, but he is planning on making it grow. His dreams are to grow in the market, have better conditions to face the competition, and to be very well known. His second dream is to buy a house and give his family better living conditions. In the future he will be entering the border markets like Brasil and Argentina. The loan is to buy a new sewing machine. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa Di

texts.es: La señora Rosa Di L. V. nació en El Jícaro Nueva Segovia, hace cuarenta y cinco años, es madre de 4 hijos donde 4 de los mayores viven de manera independiente y el último sobrevive gracias a la señora Rosa, está casada y su marido trabaja en CCN como mecánico industrial, siendo uno de los principales sustentos económicos de la familia, su mayor aspiración es el terminar de construir su vivienda, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, la mayor de las dificultades que ha tenido es que las personas a las que les vende al crédito no les han pagado de tal manera  que  no ha podido recuperar el 100% del capital invertido, ella considera que una nueva inversión de dinero le traerá nuevos productos tales como zapatos y ropa a ofertar y podrá conseguir de nuevos clientes bajo nuevas medidas de pago, esto le ayudará a su economía y le brindara mejores condiciones para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Di L. V. was born in El Jícaro Nueva Segovia, 45 years ago; she is the mother of 4 children, the adult children are living independently and the youngest is supported by Mrs. Rosa. She is married and her husband works in CCN as an industrial mechanic; his job being the principal source of economic support for the family. Her major aspiration is to finish building her house. She sells clothes and shoes; the major problem she has had is that the people that bought on credit from her have not paid, and she has not been able to recover 100% of the capital invested. She believes that a new investment of money will bring her new products such as shoes and clothes to offer, and she will be able to gain new customers under new payment agreements; this will help her finances and will bring a better quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Ms. Mariama D., aged 47, has been a member of the Moda Kone branch of UIMCEC for many years and is now on her sixth loan from the institution.  She lives in the Concorde neighborhood of Thies, a city about 50 miles from the capital Dakar.

Ms. D. has two very different small businesses: selling fabrics and raising chickens.  She began selling fabrics about five years ago, she says, as she saw a demand among her neighbors and friends.  The chicken business she began more recently.  Raising chickens can be quite profitable and Ms. D. takes the business seriously, working with a professional veterinarian to insure the health of her flock.

With the loan of 250,000 FCFA, she will purchase 150 chicks and the necessary feed to raise them to full grown chickens  Ms. D. is married and the mother of four.

loans.use: Buying chicks

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: T. Blandine est née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Blandine est mariée à LAÏBI Ezéchiel et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Djèdjèlayé à Cotonou, depuis environs 7 ans. Blandine vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Blandine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Il y a près de 11 ans que Blandine mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et des bazins dans son atelier situé à Djèdjèlayé. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Blandine s'approvisionne. Blandine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. La clientèle de Blandine s'accroît au jour le jour. Mais Blandine ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour développer son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est ce qui a conduit Blandine à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
T. Blandine was born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to LAÏBI Ezéchiel and is the mother of four children, who are all in school.  The family has been living in the Djèdjèlayé district in Cotonou for about seven years.  She helps out her husband where family expenses are concerned, thanks to the revenues that her business earns. Blandine has never attended school, but she learned how to sew.  For nearly eleven years, she has been operating a business selling cloth and damask fabrics in her workshop located in Djèdjèlayé.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she stocks up.  She has already benefited from two ALIDé loans, which she has repaid.  Her customers are growing in number day by day.  But she lacks sufficient funds for developing her business and for satisfying her customers more.  This is what's leading Blandine to requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bolts of cloth

loans.name: José Gerardo

texts.es:
José Gerardo S. V., tiene la edad de 36 años, es soltero, y tiene un hijo, que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 12 años de edad. Además, el vive en la casa de un hermano, con la esposa y dos hijos del hermano, pero el vela por su madre la cual tiene el mal de Parkinson. El crédito lo quiere para asistir 3 hectáreas de café que posee, para así poder comprar el abono, fumigarlo y poder realizarle las chapias de manera adecuada.El darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo va a permitir un buen desarrollo y así tener una mayor producción y por ende mayores ingresos económicos.Don Gerardo siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lo heredó de su padre.
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo el estudio para llegar a verlo todo un profesional, además desea seguir ayudando a su madre, ofrecerle a ambos una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
José Gerardo S. V., 36, is single and has a 12-year-old son, who is his main priority in life. He lives in his brother’s house, with his sister-in-law and their two children, but he cares for his mother, who has Parkinson’s. He will use the funding for his 3 hectares of cultivated coffee fields. He will buy fertilizers, nourish the plants and be able to prune them properly. By giving the proper care to his plants they will develop optimally and produce greater crop yields, thus: higher income. Gerardo has always been a farmer; he inherited it from his father. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is happy with the loan terms offered. He hopes in the future to be able to provide his son with advanced schooling so that he will become a professional. He also wants to continue to assist his mother, offering them both a better quality of life and improved economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Sokhna Amy

texts.en:
Ms. Sokhna Amy S. is a young entrepreneur from the Cité Senghor neighborhood of Thies, a city located about 70 km from the bustling city of Dakar.  

She reports she has been a commercante (trader) for about five years, selling guedia (dried fish), yett (a small shell-fish) and tir (palm oil).  She also purchases fabrics for her husband to embroider which she then sells to her customers.  She runs her business out of her home and enjoys working with her husband.  She will use her loan to purchase both seafood and fabrics.

The couple has three children aged four months, four and eight.  Ms. S. and her husband also take care of their nephew who lives with them.  This is the first loan for Ms. S..

loans.use: Purchase seafood and fabrics

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela A. C., tiene la edad de 18 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos. Ella vive con sus padres y dos hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de 2 vacas para la cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia.Su padre se dedica  a la ganadería desde hace más de diez años y ella desea cooperar con esa actividad familiar. Es la primera vez que Marianela  se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, además que está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, además de poderse ayudar con sus estudios.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Marianela A. C., age 18, is single and has no children. She lives with her parents and two brothers. The loan she wants is for the purchase of two cows that that will bear calves. When the calves are grown she will sell them and obtain a profit. Her father has been involved with cattle-raising for ten years, and she wishes to collaborate with this family business.

This is the first time she has sought financing with FUDECOSUR. She states that the loan committee has helped her a lot. In addition, she is very happy with the terms they have offered her. She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life in the future and a more stable income. She also wants to be able to help with her school expenses. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for breeding

loans.name: Piedad Jasmina

texts.es:
La señora Piedad es otra de las socias del Banco Comunal  Creciendo para el Futuro  desde hace siete ciclos,   en este banco se reúnen un aproximado de veinte socias cada quince días en casa de una de ellas.

 Piedad  se caso  hace diez  años y tiene dos niños, su esposo es profesor en segunda enseñanza y gracias al esfuerzo conyugal lograron construir su vivienda propia que está ubicada en el sector El Parque Forestal  a las afueras de  la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Nuestra socia  es  profesional en la rama de belleza hace tres años, realiza todo lo que es  corte y tinturado de cabello, manicure y pedicure, su forma de trabajar es visitando de casa en casa a sus clientas que la mayoría son mujeres, así ha podido desenvolverse muy bien en este arte que le genera buenos ingresos, con este nuevo préstamo va a invertir en la compra de  esmaltes, tintes,  tijeras, secadora de cabello entre otros productos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Piedad has been a member of the Creciendo para el Futuro communal bank for 7 loan cycles. This communal bank has about 20 members and they meet every two weeks in one of the member's homes. Piedad got married ten years ago and she has two children. Her husband is a high-school teacher. Thanks to their efforts as a couple, they managed to build their own house, which is located in the Parque Forestal sector in the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo. Piedad has been a beautician for three years. She does everything related to hair cutting and coloring, manicures and pedicures. She visits her customers, who are mostly women, in their homes to provide her services. She has developed well in this art, which generates good earnings for her. She will use this new loan to buy nail polish, hair dyes, scissors and hair dryers, among other products that are necessary in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nail polish, hair dye, scissors, hair dryers.

loans.name: Daysi Antonia

texts.es: Las señora Daysi Antonia V. M., es madre soltera de 43 años tiene  bajo su responsabilidad al menor de los hermanos y depende económicamente de la señora Daysi, tiene otros dos hijos pero viven de manera independiente, ella es miembro de la Policía Nacional y tiene un pequeño negocio de una venta de abarrotes, dentro de las mayores dificultades que la señora ha tenido han sido los numerables asaltos que le han acechado estos últimos años, ella planea a futuro mejorar su vivienda para reforzarla con mayor  seguridad para que sus hijos vivan en un lugar más optimo, pero para realizar esto ella solicita de este préstamo e invertirle a la pulpería en la compra de mayor inventario que aumente el  volumen de las ventas y asegure una mejor estabilidad para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Daysi Antonia V. M. is a single mother, age 43. She is responsible for caring for her youngest child, who is economically dependent upon her. She has two other children, but they live independently. She is a member of the National Police and has a small business selling groceries.

Among the greatest difficulties that she has had have been the numerous robberies she has had to be on the lookout for these last few years. She plans to improve her way of life in the future by strengthening her security so that her children live in a better place. In order to achieve this, she is applying for this loan. She will invest it in her small grocery shop by purchasing a larger inventory that will increase the volume of sales and assure better stability for all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products for her grocery store

loans.name: Tedy Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Tedy es integrante  del Banco Comunal Creciendo para el Futuro desde hace dos ciclo,  este banco se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la costa ecuatoriana, ella posee una tienda desde hace un año en la cual expende productos de primera necesidad, agua, gas,  entre otros, su negocio  está ubicado en su domicilio en el Parque Forestal a las afueras de Portoviejo compartiendo con su esposo su único compañero ya que sus  hijos son  casados y viven independientes

A sus 54 años nuestra socia está muy motivada por seguir en su negocio y con este nuevo préstamo podrá incrementar en su tienda con arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal y más víveres en general para dar un mejor servicio a su exigente clientela.
texts.en:
Tedy has been a member of the Creciendo para el Futuro communal bank for two loan cycles. This bank meets in the city of Portoviejo on the Ecuadorean coast. She has had a grocery store for the last year that stocks basic needs items, water, gas, etc. Her store is located in her home, which is Parque Forestal in Portoviejo's outskirts. Her only company is her husband because their children are all married and living independently. At the age of 54, Tedy is still very motivated to continue with her work and she will use this new funding to increase her stock with rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt, and other supplies in general to offer better service to her demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Edith Yesenia

texts.es: Edith Yesenia H. de 21 años de edad, reside en Jayaque, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su madre, su abuela y dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, los cuales dependen absolutamente de ella. Desde hace 8 años que Edith posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, los cuales son muy necesarios en los hogares. Pero a pesar de todo esto, en muchas ocasiones ella se ha enfrentado con la situación de no contar con el producto que las personas llegan a comprar. Es por esta razón que Edith solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir la tienda con diferentes productos tales como: frijoles, sal, azúcar, verduras, pan y otros más. Esto sería de mucha ayuda para ella, debido a que la tienda es la única fuente de ingresos que tanto Edith como su familia  poseen para seguir adelante, para ella el trabajo es difícil sobre todo porque debe sacar adelante a sus dos hijos quienes la necesitan mucho. A pesar de la situación tan dura a la que se enfrentan, Edith no pierde la esperanza de poder mejorar su negocio este año y así incrementar las ventas y mejorar la forma de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Edith Yesenia H. is 21 years old and lives in Jayaque, a district of La Libertad. She lives with her mother, her grandmother, and her 2 children who are 7 and 3 years old and who depend entirely upon her for their support. For the past 8 years, Edith has had a store selling perishable and highly sought after products, which are needed in the home. But in spite of all this, many times she has not been able to provide the products people come to buy. It is for this reason Edith is asking for a loan, in order to have enough money to stock the store with different products like beans, salt, sugar, vegetables, bread, etc. This would be a big help to her, due to the fact that the store is the only source of income that Edith and her family have for getting ahead. Her job is mainly difficult because she has the responsibility of helping out her two children, who both need her so much. In spite of the difficult situation she faces, Edith does not lose her hope of improving her business this year and increasing sales and improving her family's lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, bread, and vegetables

loans.name: Tomas Elmer

texts.es: Tomas Elmer F. H. de 34 años de edad, reside en Cayultitán, departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Tomas, posee una venta de tamales especiales, los cuales están rellenos de carne de gallina india, lo cual por el hecho de ser de gallina los convierte en  algo muy atractivo para las personas del lugar, sobre todo porque su negocio está ubicado en Olocuilta, un lugar muy famoso en el país por sus pupusas, el cual es muy visitado por turistas de todos los lugares del país e incluso extranjeros, esto contribuye a que Tomas venda grandes cantidades de tamales. Es por esto que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para hacer la masa de los tamales, así mismo comprar las gallinas y verduras, esto con el fin de poder elaborar mayor cantidad de tamales y de esta forma aprovechar la clientela y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la cual cuenta su familia, es por ello que Tomas debe ingeniárselas para poder mejorar las condiciones del negocio, ya que dependen en absoluto de las ganancias generadas por este.
texts.en:
Tomas Elmer F. H., 34, lives in Cayultitán in the department of La Paz. He lives together with his wife and his two younger children, who are students. Tomas sells tamales which are filled with chicken meat. This type of meat is very appealing to people in this area, as his business is located in Olocuilta, a place that is very famous for their pupusas (thick tortillas typically stuffed with cheese, meat, and/or beans) and is visited by many tourists from all over the country as well as foreigners. These tourists allow Tomas to sell great numbers of tamales. He is asking for a loan so he can buy greater quantities of corn to make the dough for the tamales and so he can buy more chickens and vegetables. The loan will allow him to increase the number of tamales he produces and thus take advantage of his client base and increase sales. The tamales are his only source of income with which to support his family. It is for this reason that Tomas must be able to improve the conditions of his business, as his family is completely dependent upon the profits generated by it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, chickens, and vegetables

loans.name: Susana Audelia

texts.es: Susana tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, los dos mas grandes ya trabajan y la ayudan en los gastos del hogar, tiene una tienda y venta de comida, Susana atiende muy amablemente su negocio, es por eso que en tampoco tiempo su negocio ha prosperado esto le anima aún mas a poder salir adelante y solventar las necesidades de su familia, quienes son la razón de su esfuerzo. El sueño a futuro de Susana es tener más clientes y mas ventas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con la fundación FAPE, El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido para comprar productos para hacer la venta de las refacciones y cumplir con las entregas a los establecimientos para los que trabaja.
texts.en:
Susana is 43 and lives with her husband and 3 children. Her two oldest children are already working and help her with their home's expenses. She has a store and sells food. She is very friendly when she attends to her business, and that's why it has prospered. This motivates her even more to get ahead and to solve her family's economic needs. Her family is the reason that she works so hard. Her dream for the future is to have more clients and sales. This is her first loan with FAPE. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies and to fulfill the orders of the establishments for which she works.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her store

loans.name: Xiomara Carina

texts.es: Xiomara Carina H. L. de 33 años de edad, reside en Olocuilta, departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su hija de 6 años de edad, quien estudia, y la cual es el motor que le da fuerzas a Xiomara como madre para esforzarse a diario por brindarle lo mejor a su hija, ya que ella depende por completo de Xiomara. Ella posee una venta de pupusas en el lugar más famoso, en el cual se comercializan las mejores pupusas del país, esto le permite contar con muchos clientes tanto de la zona como de otros lugares. 10 años de experiencia le han permitido ir adquiriendo buenas referencias, lo cual la convierte en una de las más solicitas en el lugar. Es por esta razón que Xiomara solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su venta, comprando productos como arroz, frijoles, queso chicharrón, más bebidas frías, de manera que ella cuente con la capacidad de atender mayor cantidad de clientes. Xiomara es una persona muy trabajadora, alegre y dedicada a su trabajo, lo cual es muy beneficioso para ella, ya que en gran manera por estas cualidades, las personas acuden a su negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara Carina H. L. is 33 years old and lives en Olocuilta, department of La Paz. She lives with her 6-year old daughter who is the motor giving Xiomara strength, as a mother, to try every day to give the best to her daughter, since she is completely dependant of Xiomara. She owns a Pupusa (traditional Salvadorean dish) eatery in the most famous place (i.e., Olocuilta) where the best Pupusas of the country are sold; the location allows her to have many customers, both local and from other areas. With 10 years of experience she has acquired good references, making her one of the most sought after in the place. For this reason Xiomara is requesting a loan to invest in her business and buy products such as rice, beans, cheese, pork and cold drinks so she can have the capacity to service a higher number of customers. Xiomara is a hard-working person, cheerful and dedicated to her work, qualities that are beneficial to her since they are largely the reason why people patronize her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, cheese and cold drinks

location.town: Olocuilta en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Narciso De Jesús

texts.es: Narciso de Jesús H. S. de 43 años de edad, reside en Apaneca, en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos menores de edad, los cuales asisten a la escuela del lugar. Narciso es un señor muy trabajador, quien goza de excelentes referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que aseguran que es una persona muy tranquila, trabajadora y responsable, quien siempre se está esforzando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Debido a que hace algunos años perdió su empleo, y tomando en cuenta la difícil situación para encontrar uno nuevo, decidió emprender su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, que está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Para Narciso es de mucha importancia poder surtir el negocio, ya que solo de esta manera el podrá obtener mayores ganancias, es por esto que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual  pueda comprar granos básicos, golosinas y sodas, las cuales son más vendidas en el lugar. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Narciso quien cuenta con la esperanza de obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales le permitan ofrecerle una estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Narciso de Jesús H. S., 43 years old, lives in Apaneca, in Ahuachapán department. He lives with his wife and four underage children, which go to the local school. Narciso is a very hardworking man of whom his neighbours speak very well. They say he is a very quiet, hardworking and responsible person, always striving to improve his family's life conditions.
