He lost his job a few years ago, and given the difficulties in finding a new one, he decided to start his own business, which is a general store selling perishable products and first necessity products located in his home. For Narciso it is very important to stock up the business because it is the only way he can obtain bigger earnings. This is why he asks for a loan with which he can purchase basic grains, candy and soft drinks, which are the products he sells best. This thrills Narciso, who hopes to obtain greater earnings which will enable him to offer financial stability to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: basic grains, candy and soft drinks

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa la señora Aide Pérez.

Esteban A. H. quiere apoyar el negocio de su esposa ya que es un ingreso mas para el sustento de la familia. El negocio tiene 1 año que lo abrieron y es llamado “Abarrotes Hacienda”  en el que ellos ofrecen al cliente de todo en mercancía y a buen precio. Pero en este momento quieren comprar mas mercancía para tenerlo bien surtido.  A pesar de la crisis no dejan de trabajar por que tienen2 hijos que mantener y desean darles lo mejor que se pueda para que en un futuro sean unas personas de provecho. 
Esteban aparte el percibe ingresos por trabajar en una fabrica desde hace 1 año para poder sostener los gastos que se aproximen.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the photo is Esteban's wife, Aide Pérez.

Esteban A. H. wants to support his wife, since she provides a second income to sustain their family. The business they opened is one year old, and is called "Abarrotes Hacienda," where they sell all kinds of merchandise to customers at a good price. But now, they want to buy more merchandise to have a good stock. In spite of the crisis, they haven't stopped working because they have to children to support and they wish to give them the best so that they will have a good future.

Esteban also earns an income by working in a factory, which he has done for a year to provide for the expenses of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock a grocery store

loans.name: Ricardo Misael

texts.es: Ricardo Misael P. de 34 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Ricardo posee un negocio ubicado en el mercado de Santa Tecla, en el cual comercializa productos plásticos como platos, vasos, cubiertos y otros más. La ubicación es muy favorable, ya que cuenta con clientes que visitan el mercado como también por personas que trabajan en el mismo lugar. Ricardo desea poder aumentar su inventario, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda adquirir mayor cantidad de productos plásticos y desechables, comprándolos todo al mayoreo, de manera que pueda obtenerlos a un menor precio, esto le permitirá bajar un poco los precios y así contar con más clientela. Ricardo es un padre muy responsable quien trabaja arduamente por darle todo lo necesario a su hijo, es por ello que dentro de los planes de él está el mejorar su negocio y de esta forma mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Ricardo Misael P. is 34 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, department of La Libertad. He lives with his 12-year old son who goes to school. Ricardo owns a business located in the Santa Tecla market where he sells plastic products such as plates, cups, utensils, and other products. It is a favorable location since he has customers from people that visit the market as well as people that work in the market. Ricardo wishes to increase his inventory and that is why he is requesting a loan which he will use to acquire a bigger quantity of plastic and disposable products; he will buy them wholesale to get a lower price which will allow him to lower his prices and get more customers. Ricardo is a very responsible father and works hard to provide for his son; for this reason, his plans include to improve his business in order to improve his family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic products

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sonia Aracely

texts.es: Sonia Aracely C. A. de 31 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas. Vive junto a su hija de 11 años de edad y un hermano de 17 años, ambos se dedican a trabajar y a ayudarle con el negocio. Sonia posee una tortillería, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa, ahí las personas llegan a recoger las tortillas o las reparten a domicilio con la ayuda de su hija y su hermano, esto último lo hacen con el fin de abarcar mayor cantidad de clientes y de esta manera poder vender más. Sonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, de manera que cuente con más materia prima y así poder aumentar su producción diaria, ya que hay muchas personas que llegan a comprar tortillas y no se les puede atender por falta de masa para hacerlas. Sonia desea poder obtener mayores ganancias y así contar con una mejor estabilidad económica, lo cual le asegure una mejor vida a su hija y su hermano, los cuales dependen por completo de Sonia.
texts.en:
Sonia Aracely C. A. is 31 years old. She lives in Sensuntepeque, in the department of Cabañas. She lives with her 11-year-old daughter and a 17-year-old brother, who both work and help her with the business. Sonia owns a tortilla shop, which she runs out of her house. People come to pick up the tortillas or she delivers them to their homes with the help of her daughter and brother. They deliver to people's homes so they can attract more clients and sell more tortillas. Sonia is requesting a loan so she can buy more corn and expand her daily production, since a lot of people buy her tortillas and she doesn't have enough to fill everyone's orders. Sonia wants to earn more and attain financial stability, which will help her offer her brother and daughter, who depend on her, a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa J. is a trader and rents a shop on a major business route. She trades in provisions and other assorted items. She is married to a businessman with two daughters. She has been in business for the past four years.

Massa is in need of a loan to increase her stock in her shop. She has proven to have a very good credit history in individual lending. She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to pay for one of her daughter's university fees and to buy a piece of land.

She is very modest and spends her entire time in her business without assistance from her relatives.

loans.use: To buy assorted provisions

loans.name: Shalom 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Teolinda is the coordinator of her group, Shalom. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town in the east of the DR where the economy is based around agriculture. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. 

Teolinda is excited to be receiving her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business by purchasing pants and blouses by the dozen to sell to her clients. She will use the profits to invest in her home and her children. Her long-term dream is to see her children become professionals. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai S. is a trader and has a stall where he sells men's jeans and clothes. He is married and his wife has a business selling local foods. They have two children and employ one assistant in the stall.

The stall is well located along one of the major roads in Bo city and is easily reached by his customers.

Abdul has about ten years experience in business.  He is seeking a loan to buy jeans and other men's wear from Guinea and Gambia to meet his customers' needs.

He plans to use the proceeds of his loan to start the construction of his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing

loans.name: Francess

texts.en:
Francess A. is a business woman who rents a drug store at a major lorry park (transport station) called New London in Bo. She has two years of experience in this business.  She has a shop assistant who she pays on a monthly basis to help run the business.  Francess is married to a clergy man.

She also works with a non-governmental organization as an administrative and finance officer and she has a degree in accounting.

She is requesting a loan to increase her stock to better meet her customers' demands.  The cost is high due to the exchange rate in purchasing pharmaceuticals from Guinea

She hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to pay the fees of her two children and dependents.

loans.use: To buy drugs for her store

loans.name: Rosmery Guadalupe

texts.es: Rosmery Guadalupe T. 26  años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas. Vive junto a su madre, la cual posee una venta de pupusas. Rosmery cuenta con una venta de productos varios como: maquillaje, crema para cuerpo y cabello, shampoo, accesorios, carteras y muchos otros productos más. Ella posee su negocio en el mercado Municipal de Sensuntepeque obteniendo muy buenas ganancias, las cuales son utilizadas para el mantenimiento de su hogar, es por esta razón que Rosmery trabaja desde muy joven para poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su madre, ya que es ella quien luchó por muchos años por darle una vida digna a Rosmery. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar medicina natural y de esta manera poder extender su negocio, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad de productos de los que ya posee, y los cuales es consciente que se venden mucho en el lugar tales como los cosméticos. A Rosmery le llena de mucha ilusión el imaginarse un negocio muy surtido en el cual pueda obtener mayores ganancias, es por esto que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosmery Guadalupe T. is 26 and she lives in Sensuntepeque, which is in the Cabañas department. She lives with her mother, who sells pupusas. Rosmery sells different products such as makeup, body and hair lotion, shampoo, accessories, bags and many more products. She runs her business at the Sensuntepeque Municipal market and is making a very good profit which is used for household expenses. This is the reason Rosmery has worked since she was very young - to be able to provide her mother with the help she needs, since she has fought for many years to give Rosemery a decent life. She is asking for a loan so that she can buy natural medicine and so expand her business, as well as buying greater quantities of the products that she already has, such as cosmetics, which she is confident will sell well . Rosemery is full of hope imagining a well stocked business in which she can earn greater profits and this is why she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural medicine and cosmetics.

loans.name: Santos Noé

texts.es: Santos Noé T. de 50 años de edad, reside en Cuscatancingo, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa y sus dos hijas. Él posee un taller de reparación de calzado para ambos sexos. 32 años son lo que tiene Santos Noé de dedicarse al mismo oficio, el cual le ha permitido durante tantos años mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante. Él es una persona muy amable quien aprecia mucho su manera de ganarse la vida, ya que hasta ahora no le ha hecho falta nada y ha sido gracias a este. Es por esta razón que santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar suelas, hilos, agujas especiales para reparar calzado y todo los materiales necesarios para este fin, Santos desea comprar todo este producto al mayoreo, ya que de esta manera podrá obtenerlo a menores precios. Santos es un hombre muy responsable y de buenos valores quien cuenta con el cariño de sus vecinos y con muy buenas referencias, ya que es alguien que siempre se ha esforzado por seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Santos Noé T. is 50 years old and a resident of Cuscatancingo, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker, and their two daughters. He owns a shoe repair shop that handles footwear for both men and women. When he was 32 years old, Santos Noé dedicated himself to this trade which has allowed him to support his family over the years and help them move forward. He is a likeable person who appreciates his means of earning a living. Until now, he has not been lacking anything and for this he is very thankful.

Santos is requesting a loan so that he can buy soles, thread, special needles for repairing shoes, and all the other necessary materials for his job. He wants to buy these products in bulk so that he can get a lower price. Santos is a responsible gentleman with good values. He has the respect of his neighbors, presents good references, and always strives for success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & materials for repairing shoes

loans.name: Magua En Desarrollo 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Ivelisse is the coordinator of her group Magua en Desarrollo (Magua in Development). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally.

The group members live in the areas surrounding Hato Mayor, a dusty agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Ivelisse makes her home here in a simple structure with her children.

Ivelisse is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous six loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing blouses and blue jeans to sell.

Ivelisse will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing clothing and school supplies for her children and a scooter for mobility. Her long-term dream is to own a larger home and to have a safe vehicle. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses and jeans to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward B. is a proprietor of a Relaxation pub and provision store. He is married and has three kids. He is normally assisted by his wife.

The business has been in existence for about six years and they have succeeded in leasing a piece of land that is strategically located for their type of business.

Edward is also an undergraduate in one of the universities in Sierra Leone where he does part-time photography.

Edward seeks a loan to get more stock for his his pub and provision store.

He hope to use the proceeds of the loan to complete payment of the lease and pay the school fees for his kids.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 73 años su actividad económica es venta de tortillas y cuajadas. Hace más de 34 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una actividad que le gusta mucho pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano, para realizar las cuajadas para ofrecerlas a sus clientes. Irma es una mujer muy responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo ya que por medio de él ha podido mantener a su hijo de 14 años de edad, que está a su cargo y con mucho esfuerzo le ha brindado lo necesario. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, cuajada y leña que son la materia prima necesaria para la buena elaboración de sus productos. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio que su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Irma is 73 years old and sells tortillas and curds. She has been in this business for more than 34 years. Irma enjoys her work very much and wakes up very early each day to start making the curds to sell to her customers. She is a very responsible woman who works hard to support her 14 year old child and provide everything that is needed.

This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase corn, curds, and firewood, which are the raw materials needed to make her products properly. Irma hopes to succeed in this business since it is her only means of making a living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making tortillas & curds

loans.name: Jorge Alexander

texts.es: Jorge Alexander M. L. de 32 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa. Él posee un taller de automóviles, en el que se encarga de reparar y vender repuestos para vehículos. Jorge es una persona que ha aprendido mucho y es muy preparada, razón por la cual desarrolla un muy buen trabajo, lo que llena de satisfacción a sus clientes y así mismo le permite obtener nuevos. Como todo hombre visionario él desea crecer más en su negocio, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en el taller comprar más repuestos, de diferentes marcas, así como también contratar nuevo personal para que le ayuden a atender el negocio, ya que Jorge cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes. Es a través de este trabajo como él se gana la vida y obtiene el dinero necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar es por esto que es muy importante mejorar el servicio al cliente y mejorar el tiempo en que se entregan los vehículos a los clientes, lo cual lo logrará contando con los repuestos necesarios y el personal adecuado.
texts.en:
Jorge Alexander M. L. is 32 years old. He and his wife are residents of Santa Tecla, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. Jorge runs an auto repair shop and also sells spare parts. He is very knowledgeable and always prepared, which explains why he is very good at his job. His existing customers are very satisfied and his reputation allows him to attract new ones.

Like any other man with a vision, Jorge wants to expand his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in his shop by purchasing more parts of different brands. He plans to hire new employees to help attend to the business because he has many customers. It is through his work that Jorge is able to earn a living and obtain the income he needs to meet all of his household expenses. He believes it is very important to improve customer service and turnaround times when servicing each vehicle. These goals can be achieved when he has sufficient parts and adequate staff.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automobile parts

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en:
Jestina S. is a trained hair dresser who has been in business for 10 years. She trades in hair products and rents a salon at the back of the central market. She also trains girls in vocational skills of hair dressing.

She has spent a great part of her lifetime in hair dressing and sale of hair products. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a social worker who is closely linked to the business as adviser.

Jsetina is seeking a loan to buy more stock and improve on the technology and method of service to her customers. She hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to complete their house and pay the college fees for her kids, two of whom are in high school.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics/salon products.

loans.name: Laura Lissette

texts.es: Laura Lissette S. C. de 30 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, departamento de San Salvador. Vive en la casa de su madre junto a ella, su esposo y su hija de 9 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Laura posee una cafetería la cual está ubicada en una escuela en el municipio de San Bartolo siempre ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Razón por la cual desea poder surtirla, ya que en este mes de enero se iniciaron las clases, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar golosinas, pan, bebidas, galletas, fruta y otros productos más, los cuales los niños compran más, así mismo desea comprar arroz, verduras y otros productos más para la elaboración de almuerzos, que son vendidos a los maestros de la escuela. Laura espera poder ver crecer su negocio y aumentar las ventas lo cual será de mucho beneficio para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Laura Lissette S. C. is 30 years old and a resident of Ilopango, Department of San Salvador. She lives at home with her mother, her husband, and her 9 year old daughter who is a student. Laura operates a cafeteria at a school in the town of San Bartolo in the Department of San Salvador. She wants to restock her business because January is when classes begin. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy sweets, bread, beverages, cookies, fruit, and other products that children buy. She also wants to purchase rice, vegetables, and other ingredients for preparing lunches to sell to the school teachers. Laura hopes to grow her business and increase her sales, which will benefit her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various food items to restock her business

loans.name: The Women’S Bank United For A Better Tomorrow (1) Group

texts.en:
The official name of this group translates as “The Women’s Bank United for a Better Tomorrow”. This will be the group’s second loan from Fundacion Mujer. The first was for 100,000 colones for each group member, and was paid back on time and in full. The members of this group live in Coto Brus, Puntarenas, a rural community located in the southern region of Costa Rica near the Panamanian border.

These women are in the business of animal rearing. They work with cows, pigs and chickens. This loan will be used for the purchase of animals as well as general investments in activities conducive to the healthy upbringing of animal livestock such as food, shelter and nutrients.

Cows, pigs and chickens are raised by the women until they are ready to be sold. Chickens are generally sold in the community, to neighbors, friends and acquaintances, whereas pigs and cows are sold to purchasers who travel to the community from nearby cities. These purchasers can be middlemen/women who will resell the pigs or cows to butchers for final use. The purchasers may also be the butchers themselves.

The group members’ families benefit greatly from their livestock businesses. In general, the women have the goal of rendering the earnings generated through their sales more stable by acquiring more livestock and seeking out new clients. An obstacle for the group has been the unpredictable effects of animals becoming sick. Changes in climate have affected the quality and quantity of grazing land for cows as well as the susceptibility of chickens and pigs to disease.

Jennifer P. A. is the 21-year-old mother of two who lives in Coto Brus. She had her first child when she was sixteen years old. She has a business rearing and selling pigs which she started with an initial investment of 100,000 colons. Jennifer appreciates the importance of providing a quality product to her clients in order to keep them coming back to her instead of choosing another producer. The values she expects her group to display are responsibility, solidarity and honesty.

Maritza G. P. is a 32 year old woman who lives in Coto Brus with her husband of sixteen years and their four children. She has a business rearing and selling cows. Maritza says she wants her business to grow in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family. She comments that before she was approved for her loan she was afraid; with the loan, she feels secure.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ulda Maria

texts.es: Ulda Maria tiene 38 años, esta joven tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente 2 están a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 14 años que se dedica  a este negocio, ella va a realizar la compra de sus productos porque es mucho más favorable comprar al por mayor. Ella no tiene mucha competencia pues el lugar donde habita es una comarca donde ella vende de manera accesible y no tiene mucha competencia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, pan, leche, pollo, detergentes y jabón. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ulda Maria is 38 years old. This young woman has four children, of whom only two are in her care. She has been operating a grocery store for the past 14 years. Ulda plans to buy more merchandise because it is better to acquire them in bulk. Her business is located in a region that is accessible and does not have much competition.

The loan she is requesting will be use as operating capital to buy candy, natural sodas, juices, bread, milk, chicken, detergents, and soap. She hopes to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: El Cupesi Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cupesi” esta representado por la señora Olga y conformado por 17 miembros que van cursando su primer ciclo con la institución, todos los miembros son padres y madres D. familia muy trabajadores y emprendedores. Entre las actividades que realizan esta la venta D. hojalatería, herrería,  pan, pollo, queso, comida, perfumes, electrodomésticos, abarrotes y a la prestación D. servicios como maestra, la dedicación D. las socias a sus negocios es bastante ya que muchas D. ellas dependen del ingreso diario para mantener a sus familias por ejemplo la señora Olga se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesas en el cruce D. dos avenidas para sustentar a sus dos hijos ella es casada pero dada la situación lo que gana su esposo no les alcanza para pagar el alquiler, servicios básicos y la educación D. sus  hijos por lo que en la mañana se dedica a repartir el periódico y en el transcurso D. la tarD. y la noche empieza a vender sus hamburguesas con la ayuda D. sus pequeños. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para mejorar sus negocios y poder adquirir mejor ingresos para el mejoramiento D. sus hogares y la posibilidad D. darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. A pesa D. ser su primer ciclo las socias del grupo ya tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben que se necesita para poder seguir contando con el apoyo económico y con la confianza D. nuestra institución, muchas ganas D. trabajar, muchas ganas D. salir adelante y sobre todos unidad en sus grupo.
texts.en:
The "Cupesi" group is represented by Olga, and includes 17 members who are in their first loan cycle with this institution. They are all mothers and fathers, and are hard-working and entrepreneurial. They are involved in businesses like tinsmithing, blacksmithing, selling bread, chicken, cheese, food, perfume, appliances, and groceries, as well as providing services like teaching. The dedication of these people is high, since they depend on their businesses for daily income to sustain their families.

For example, Olga sells hamburgers at the intersection of two avenues to proviD. for her two children. She is married, but given her husband's income, they don't have enough to pay for rent, basic services, and education for their children. That is why she delivers newspapers in the morning and sells hamburgers in the afternoon and evening, with the help of her small children.

These loans will be used to buy ingredients, materials, and tools to improve their businesses and increase their incomes, so they can improve their homes and give their families a better quality of life. Although this is their first loan cycle, the members of this group already have experience with group loans and know that the group is necessary for them to have access to this economic support and they need to keep the trust of our institution. They have a strong desire to work and to get ahead, and they are united in this group.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Don

texts.en: Don has a full-time job working with the United States Government. He was also looking for a way to create a stream of extra income and become his own boss, so he researched possible businesses. He discovered an ATM (Automated Teller Machine) franchising opportunity which met his criteria. By placing and maintaining ATMs at hotels and other travel businesses in the Washington D.C. area, Don earns part of the convenience fee busy travelers pay. Don’s ACCION USA loan will allow him to expand by adding another ATM placement. He plans to continue growing his business, hoping to eventually hire staff. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To add another ATM placement

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: La señora Elia Maria tiene venta de comida, la cual se encuentra ubicada en la esquina opuesta de la gasolinera esso, ella es una persona muy trabajadora además está muy feliz con su negocio.  Ella realiza sus compras en el mercado oriental ya que en ese lugar los productos los cuales utiliza para su negocio son más baratos y le genera un poco de mejores ingresos. Elia es madre de tres hijos los cuales ya se encuentran trabajando. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos que son necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Elia María owns a food store located in a corner across an ESSO gas station. She is a very hard working woman and is very happy about her business. She does her shopping on the oriental market because the products she uses for her business are cheaper there and that generates a little better earnings, She is a mother of three children who are already at work. The financing she asks for is for working capital, to purchase basic grains that she needs to make her products. Her wish is to carry on with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more calves and feed

loans.name: Restauracion 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Restauracion (Restoration), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Santa is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling clothing by purchasing pants, shoes and blouses. She will use the profits to save toward her long-term dream of owning her own salon. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pants, shoes and blouses for resale

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Estrellitas” esta representado por la señora Herminia y conformado por 14 miembros que van cursando juntos ya un segundo ciclo todos los miembros del grupo son madres u padres de familia por lo que sus hijos son su principal preocupación en especial lo concerniente a su educación y su futuro, muchos de los socios tienen no solo un trabajo para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos ya que también están las muchas obligaciones es por esta razón que requieren de un préstamo que pueda ayudarles en sus capital de trabajo para la compra de insumos, mercadería, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus productos terminados y mejoren sus negocios para tener mayores ganancias que se traducirán en una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.  La mayoría de las socias se dedican al negocio de venta de comida ya sea en el mercado, en las noches en sus barrios y los fines de semana se dedican a la venta en ferias locales, otras de las socias se dedican al tejido, a la venta de pan, refrescos, bebidas y a prestar servicios de transporte público en el área urbana, por ejemplo la presidenta la señora Herminia se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado central y en las noches se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas en la puerta de sus domicilio, ella debe mantener sola a sus tres niños ya que es divorciada paro no le hace falta nada ella se abastece para sacar adelante a sus hijos en especial porque el sueño de ella es sacar profesionales a sus hijos y así darles un mejor futuro.  La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante. Los socios van cursando ya un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de salir adelante con trabajo y esfuerzo para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Las Estrellitas" (The Little Stars) is represented by Herminia and includes 14 members who are going through their second loan cycle. All the members of the group are mothers and fathers, so their children are their primary concern, especially their education and future. Many of these members have more than one job to cover the necessities for their children, since they have a lot of obligations. That is why they are requesting this loan to give them working capital so they can buy ingredients, merchandise, materials, and tools to help them improve their finished products and improve their businesses. This way, they will have better incomes that will translate into a better quality of life for their families.

The majority of these members sell food, either in a market, in the evenings in their neighborhoods, or on weekends in local fairs. Others are weavers, or sell bread, soda and drinks, or provide public transportation in urban areas. For example, Herminia sells vegetables in the central market, and at night she sells hamburgers in the entrance of her home. She has to support her three children alone, since she is divorced. But she doesn't lack anything; she is able to provide for her children to help them get ahead, since she wants them to become professionals and have a better future.

Competition is high in these commercial areas, but these members know how to get ahead. They are entering their second loan cycle, having demonstrated responsibility, honesty, and eagerness to get ahead by working to improve their quality of life and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de uso medico como jeringas, guantes quirúrgicos, fármacos, etc. Las ventas las realiza acudiendo ella misma a ofrecer estos productos a hospitales, farmacias, consultorios médicos, etc. y los vende al por mayor. Su meta es ser una de las más importantes distribuidoras de estos artículos médicos a todos los establecimientos de salud de su zona. 
Pero al ser una mujer de negocios y también madre, no descuida la atención de sus hijos, es por ello que distribuye su horario para no descuidar su hogar. Hasta  el momento Ana manifiesta que es un negocio rentable y una primordial fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Esta es la  sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, como parte de un banco comunal se mantiene perseverante y promueve la responsabilidad en su grupo, ya que para ella trabajar en equipo es lo más gratificante. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más artículos médicos, en mayores cantidades, ya que los últimos meses sus pedidos han aumentado.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old, she lives with her husband and two children in their own home. For the past 12 years she has been selling medical supplies such as syringes, surgical gloves, medicines, etc. She goes personally to offer her products to hospitals, chemist's, medical consults, etc., and she sells them wholesale. Her goal is becoming one of the most important distributors of medical supplies to the health establishments in her area. However, being a businesswoman and also a mother, she does not neglect her children's care, which is why she arranges her schedule so as not to neglect her home. For the time being Ana says that the business is profitable and a very important source of income for her family. This is the sixth time she asks for a loan from MFP. As part of a Communal Bank she is persevering and promotes responsibility in her group, since for her team work is most gratifying. The money she asks for now will be invested in the purchase of more medical supplies, in larger quantities, since in the last few months the number of orders she has taken has risen.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: medical supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada en la ciudad de Huancayo.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender granos, los cuales compra al por mayor en las zonas rurales de su zona, directamente a los agricultores, y durante los fines de semana los lleva a las ciudades aledañas para comercializarlos. Así obtiene ganancias semanales que le permiten abastecerse de nueva mercadería constantemente.
Para Antonia su negocio es rentable porque lleva productos alimenticios que son escasos y muy demandados en las zonas a donde viaja, y esto la alienta para seguir trabajando por un mejor fututo.

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con el crédito que recibió la primera vez. Con el dinero que ahora solicita seguirá invirtiendo para potenciar su negocio, incrementará su mercadería comprando más granos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old, she lives with her husband and their three children in a rented house in Huancayo city. For the past 5 years she has been selling grains. She buys them in bulk in the rural zones in her area, straight from the farmers, and during the weekends she takes them to the nearby cities to sell them. That way she obtains weekly earnings that enable her to stock up with new merchandise constantly. For Antonia her business is profitable because she deals in scarce food products which are in high demand in the areas she travels to, and this gives her the impulse she needs to keep working for a better future. This is the second time in which she has a loan from MFP, which shows she was a very responsible person with the loan she got the first time. With the money she now asks for she will continue investing to boost her business. Se will increase her merchandise buying more grains wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: grains

loans.name: Los Triunfadores Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Triunfadores” esta representado por la señora Elizabeth y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales son muy emprendedores y trabajadores. Todos cuentan con negocios propios algunos en sus domicilios y otros en el mercado, tales como la venta D. empanadas y refrescos, venta D. abarrote, cosméticos, y la prestación D. servicios como el transporte público y la manicura por ejemplo la presidenta la señora Elizabeth se dedica a la educación es maestra D. primaria por lo que le encantan los niños, ella es madre D. 2 niños es casada y se esfuerza mucho para trabajar ya que da clases particulares para poder tener una ganancias extra que le permita darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto al entorno competitivo se pueD. mencionar que es alto ya que el mercado esta lleno D. productos a elección del cliente por lo que las socias se ven en la necesidad D. salir del centro D. la ciudad  a las periferias para poder efectuar sus ventas mas cómodamente, en el caso D. las señoras que venden cosméticos se pueD. decir que solo tienen la venta D. forma ambulante y que el mercado esta saturado D. promotoras por lo que se ven en la necesidad D. efectuar alguna actividad extra también como la preparación D. hamburguesas que venden en la puerta D. sus hogares. El destino del financiamiento es para la reparación D. algunas D. las viviendas D. las socias, la reparación y retapizado D. sus vehículos y la compra D. materiales e insumos para mejorar cada día mas sus ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades básicas D. sus familias. Como es un grupo nuevo no tienen mucha experiencia en créditos solidarios pero confían en sus miembros y saben que son gente trabajadora, capaz y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante es por esta razón que la fundación Agro capital les brinda un apoyo economito para ayudarles a crecer y mejorar cada vez mas.
texts.en:
The community bank "Los Triunfadores" (The Winners) is represented by Elizabeth and includes 12 members who are entrepreneurial and hardworking. They all have their own businesses, either in their homes or in the market, like selling empanadas and soft drinks, groceries and cosmetics, and providing services like public transport and manicures.

For example, the leader, Elizabeth, is a primary school teacher because she loves children. She is the mother of two children and is married. She strives to work hard, and gives private lessons so that she can earn more income to give her children a better quality of life.

In regards to the business environment, it is very competitive, since the market is full of products that customers can choose. That is why these members find it necessary to leave the center of the city to go to the outskirts so they can make more sales. In the case of the women who sell cosmetics, they only make sales door-to-door, and the market is saturated with salespeople, so they have to be involved in an additional business, like preparing hamburgers that they sell from their homes.

This loan will be used to repair the homes of some of these members, to repair and reupholster their cars, and to buy materials and ingredients to increase their incomes and meet the basic needs of their families. Since this is a new group, they don't have much experience in group loans, but they trust their fellow members and know that they are hard-working, capable people, with a strong desire to get ahead. That is why the Agrocapital foundation is giving them this economic support to help them grow and improve themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo N. C., tiene la edad de 48 años, está  casado, y tiene dos hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Uno tiene 17 y el otro 12 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Bernardo tiene 8 hectáreas de pasto brisanta, gamalote, toledo y otros, todos para el desarrollo y engorde del ganado.El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Bernardo N. C. is 48 years old, he is married and has two children who are his greatest priority. One is 17 and the other is 12. He wants the credit to buy cattle. His idea is to have cattle for a double purpose (meat and milk). He wants to keep the cattle adequately so he can obtain the highest possible earnings when it's sold. This is not the first time he asks for a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the conditions they've given him. Mr. Bernardo has 8 hectares of pasture of different kinds (brisanta, gamalote, toledo and others), all good for breeding and fattening cattle. In the future he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more financial stability, as well as being able to grow both as a person and as a cattle breeder. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando tiene 47 años, es un padre de familia dedicado y vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. 
Hace 5 años tomó la decisión de crear su propia fuente de ingresos, instalando una tienda de abarrotes que con el tiempo ha crecido y hoy es un minimarket. Debido a la gran variedad de los productos que ofrece se ha ganado la preferencia de la clientela, siendo la buena atención el valor agregado que brinda en su establecimiento. 
Armando y su esposa atienden desde muy temprano y durante todo el día, de esa manera logran alcanzar el éxito de su negocio. Su deseo a futuro es tener una distribuidora de productos alimenticios.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona responsable que ha demostrado gran habilidad para trabajar en equipo junto a sus compañeros de banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la compra de más mercadería en productos comestibles envasados, como conservas de fruta y pescado; además de detergentes.
texts.en:
Armando is 47 years old. He is a dedicated father and lives with his wife and two children. 5 years ago he made the decision to create his own source of income by starting a grocery store. With time it has grown and today it is a minimarket. Due to the wide variety of products he offers, he has won over the customers. The service is the added value his establishment offers. Armando and his wife start work very early and work all day long. This way they are able to attain success with their business. His wish for the future is to have a food product distribution. This is the second time that he has had a loan with MFP. He is a responsable person who has demonstrated a great ability to work on a team together with his fellow communal bank members. The money that he is asking for now will be used for the purchase of more packaged food product merchandise, such as fruit and fish preserves, as well as detergent.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es:
Betzabeth tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa alquilada.
Desde hace 7 años se dedica al comercio, empezó vendiendo comida y en la actualidad tiene una tienda donde vende comestibles, útiles escolares y adornos, etc.
Su negocio está instalado en su vivienda y esto le permite atender a sus hijos y no descuidar las tareas de su hogar. 
Debido a la rentabilidad de su tienda Betzabeth está planificando incrementar la cantidad en mercadería que ofrece para atraer la atención de sus vecinos y otros clientes.

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que tiene experiencia en el trabajo en equipo que se realiza en un banco comunal y está muy satisfecha al respecto. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería en abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
Betzabeth is 33 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in a rented house. She has dedicated herself to commerce for the past 7 years, having started out selling food. She now has a store where she sells food items, school supplies and decorations, etc. Her business is in her home, which allows her to still care for her children and do the housework, therefore not neglecting her household responsibilities. Given the profitability of her store, Betzabeth has planned to increase the quantity of merchandise she offers in order to attract her neighbors and other customers. This is the seventh time she has an opportunity to access credit through MFP, given she has experience working with a team such as that in a cooperative bank, and she is very grateful for this. The funds that she is currently requesting would be used to buy groceries with which to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Sonia Cristina

texts.es:
La sra. V. C. Sonia de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia en Expansion Urbana – Guadalupe – Ica es madre soltera vive junto con sus dos hijos la mayor de 13 años y el menor de 4 años quienes asisten al colegio de la zona.
Ella tiene una tienda en su mismo domicilio desde hace 3 años empezando con la venta de golosinas actualmente su negocio se encuentra surtido de gaseosas y abarrotes goza de buena clientela. 
La sra solicita que le financiemos un credito para poder adquirir un refrigerador que le ayudará a mejorar su negocio ya que tambien ha empezado a vender tuberculos y ahora en temporada de calor desea vender chupetes y otros ella es una persona que se le ve bastante responsabilidad su ideal de ella es hacer crecer cada vez mas su negocio para asi poder ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos y asi poderles brindar una carrera profesional que les permita salir adelante.
Los vecinos dan muy buenas referencias de ella dicen que es bien trabajadora colaboradora y respetuosa con todos.
texts.en:
Ms. V. C. Sonia is 38 years old and lives in a house she owns in Expansion Urbana – Guadalupe – Ica. She is a single mother, and lives with her two children ages 13 and 4 who attend the local school. She has a store in her own home that she started 3 years ago by selling snacks/sweets. Currently, her store also is supplied with sodas and groceries and enjoys a good client base. She requests credit in order to purchase a refrigerator that will help her improve her business, as she has also started selling tubers and would like to stock frozen popsicles for the summer season. She is a very responsible person who wants to see her business grow so she can save for her children’s futures. She would like to see them become professionals who enjoy a good standard of living. Her neighbors provide very good references, and state that she is a good team worker and respects everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Los Agachados Group

texts.es: El grupo  “Los Agachados ” esta representado por el señor Hugo Jesús y conformado por 12 miembros que empiezan un primer ciclo con entusiasmo y ganas D. trabajar, todos se conocen y se tienen confianza debido a que son D. la misma zona. Entre las actividades que realizan podemos mencionar la venta D. Pan, comida, cerveza, ropa y al servicio D. soldadura, transporte público y la enseñanza en escuelas. Dentro del ámbito comercial siempre existe la competencia por lo que las socias no son la excepción, muchas D. ellas deben esforzarse mucho más que sus compañeras para obtener un ingreso razonable para cumplir con sus obligaciones y con sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus ventas y por enD. mejorar mas sus ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Entre sus expectativas esta mejorar sus ventas con una mejor mercadería y poder darles a sus hijos una educación universitaria y un hogar fijo ya que una gran mayoría D. las socias no posee casa propia. En general las socias conocen el producto y la forma D. trabajar bajo la modalidad D. créditos solidarios ya que muchas D. ellas trabajaron con instituciones que también cuentan con este servicio, pero están satisfechos con el trato que les da la fundación a la cual agradecen por su  apoyo económico y su confianza.
texts.en:
The group “Los Agachados ” is led by Sr. Hugo Jesús and consists of twelve members who are starting their first loan cycle with enthusiasm and a willingness to work. All of them know and trust each other because they are from the same area. Among the businesses represented are the sale of bread, food, beer, and clothing, as well as services such as welding, public transportation, and education. There is always competition in the commercial arena and the situation that the members face is no exception. Many of them must do much more work than their peers in order to generate a reasonable income to meet their obligations and support their families.

This loan will be used to purchase supplies, materials, and tools to help them increase their sales, improve their incomes, and give their families a better quality of life. Among their expectations are to improve their sales with better merchandise, proviD. their children with a college education, and acquire a permanent home since most of the members do not own a house. In general, the members are familiar with loan products and know how to work as part of a solidarity group because of their experience with other institutions that offer this service. They are satisfied with the service provided by the Foundation and are grateful for the financial support and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Jessica Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Jessica del Socorro tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y posee 1 hijo, de un año de edad. Cabe señalarse, la señora habita con su familia, los cuales le ayudan a cuidar a su hijo mientras ella trabaja. La señora tiene un negocio peculiar, ya que ella posee un mini cyber ubicado en su casa de habitación, sin embargo su negocio principal es el levantado de texto. Ya ella tiene trece años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual dio inicio debido a la falta de empleo que hay en nuestro país, por lo que recurrió a establecer un negocio de levantado de texto, ahora posee más computadoras, por lo que decidió establecer el pequeño cyber. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de papelería para el levantamiento de texto, además que desea comprar algunos consumibles de su lugar de trabajo. El sueño siempre ha sido brindarle una buena condición económica a la vida de su hijo, el cual pretende lograr invirtiéndole más a su negocio, para que aunque quedara sin trabajo pueda tener de donde brindar la manutención de su hijo.
texts.en:
Jessica del Soccorro is 34 years old, single, and has a one year old son. It's worthy of mention that she lives with her family, who help by caring for her son while she works. Jessica has an unusual business, a mini-cyber cafe which is located in the house where she lives. Nevertheless, her principal business is converting documents to digital form. She has been doing this for 13 years. There is a lack of employment in her country and that led her to resort to this business. Now that she has more computers, she decided to open her little cyber cafe. Her loan will be invested in buying paper and other supplies for her text converting business. Her dream has always been to offer her son good economic conditions, which she hopes to achieve by investing more in her business. Even if she should remain unemployed, she would be able to provide necessities for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLES FOR HER DIGITIZING BUSINESS

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 4 Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is the coordinator of her group, Plan de Lucha (Plan to Fight!), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, where the economy is based primarily around agriculture, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner  and their five children.

Hilaria is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado, or corner store, by purchasing the basics products that her clients expect to find such as rice, beans, cooking oil and powdered milk. She will use the profits to invest in her children's education and continuing to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijas.
Desde hace 21 años vende comida en la puerta de su casa por la mañana, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para trasladar los objetos pesados. Durante la tarde se encarga de la limpieza de los utensilios y dejar todo listo para el día de mañana.
Delia cree que la rentabilidad de su negocio es porque se encuentra ubicada en una avenida muy transitada de su ciudad y gracias a sus buenas ganancias planea alquilar un local donde pueda implementar un pequeño restaurante.

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una socia que ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos no perecibles para la preparación de sus comidas;  como arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and 2 daughters. She has been selling food in the mornings from the doorway of her home for 21 years. She counts on her husband’s support, and he helps her move heavy items. In the afternoons, she is busy cleaning her utensils and getting everything ready for the following morning. Delia believes the profitability of her business is due to the fact that she is located on a very busy street, and thanks to her good earnings she plans to rent a small space to open a restaurant. This is her seventh loan through MFP, and she is a member that has shown herself to be very punctual with her payments. The funds she is now requesting would be invested into the purchase of non-perishable food items for preparing her foods, such as rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making her food.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 50 años, vive con su hija pequeña de 8 años en su casa propia.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica al comercio, pero desde hace 2 años vende artículos diversos de uso personal, como ganchos para el cabello, ropa interior, cono de hilo, etc.
Ella lleva su mercadería a las diferentes ferias comerciales que se dan en su localidad, y con esta actividad puede solventar los gastos de su familia.
Para el futuro, desea poder comprar o alquilar un puesto fijo para realizar sus ventas con mayor comodidad.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella ha demostrado con su puntualidad ser una persona de confianza y con ello, el aprecio de sus compañeros en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita se utilizará para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old and lives with her 8-year old daughter in a house she owns. She has dedicated herself to commerce for 4 years, but over the past 2 years has sold a variety of products for personal use such as hairpins, undergarments, spools of thread, etc. She takes her products to the various commercial markets held in her area, and with this activity is able to meet the financial needs of her family. In the future, she hopes to rent a fixed location from which to sell her wares. This is her third opportunity to access credit with MFP, and she has demonstrated with her punctuality that she is a trustworthy person. As such, she has earned the appreciation of the other members in her cooperative bank. The funds she is currently requesting would be used to buy additional merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Alemancito Group

texts.es: El grupo “Alemancito” esta representado por la señora Deicy y conformado por 13 miembros 10 mujeres y 3 varones todos son D. una misma zona, la mayoría D. las socias tienen su negocio y otras van a empezar uno nuevo. Entre las actividades que realizan podemos mencionar la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo, ropa interior, abarrotes, barrendera, atención entiendas D. barrio y al servicio D. albañilería. La competencia esta realmente muy difícil, especialmente en la venta D. ropa y en la venta D. cosméticos, en especial cuando no tienen un puesto fijo D. venta y se ven expuestas a las inclemencias del tiempo, pero las socias saben como salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos cada día para el sustento D. sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo para poder adquirir puestos D. venta fijos, para la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a aliviar un poco el trabajo D. los dedicados a la albañilería. En cuanto a sus expectativas los socios desean tener negocios mucho mas rendidores para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. La mayoría D. las socias cuentan con experiencia crediticia gracias a financiamientos similares pero se encuentran agradecidos por el apoyo económico D. la fundación Agrocapital ya que eso abre las puertas para un futuro mejor para sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Alemancito" is represented by señora Deicy and is formed by 13 members, of whom10 are women and 3 are men. They are all from the same zone. The majority are have their own business and others are going to start a new one. Between these activities that they do, we can mention the sale of cosmetics by catalog, underwear, general store, sweeper, neighborhood store attention and bricklaying. The competition is really difficult, especially in clothing and cosmetics sales, even more so when they don't have a fixed place to make sales and their display's look worn. But the clients know that they must move forward and improve their profits everyday to support their families.

This is the reason they require a loan: so that they can aquire fixed places to make sales, for the purchase of merchandise, consumables and work tools, that help aleviate some of the work for those bricklayers. In their expectations, the clients wish to have much more productive businesses so they can give their children a better education and a better quality of life for their families. The majority of the clients have credit experience thanks to their other finances but they are grateful for the economic support for Fundacion Agrocapital that opens doors to a better future for their families.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Marilu Cirly

texts.es:
La Sra. F. A. Marilu Cirly de 53 años de edad es natural de Arequipa vive en Ica desde hace 7 años ella actualemnte habita en un cuarto alquilado desde hace 4 años en Huacachina donde es su trabajo diariamente.
Ella tiene una hija de 25 años la cual vive en Arequipa ya se encuentra casada y le envia aveces dinero a su madre.
se encarga del control del baño en Huacachina y también vende articulos de limpieza personal fuera del mismo ella se ha ganado la confianza de los jefes de la municipalidad por ser bien responsable.
La sra solicita que le financiemos un credito para mejorar un ambiente que ha comprado con sus ahorros en Huacachina mismo su sueño es poner un negocio de comida mas adelante lo que le permitiria obtener un mejor ingreso.
Los vecinos dan muy buenas referencias de ella dicen que es bien trabajadora colaboradora y respetuosa con todos.
texts.en:
F. A. Marilu Cirly, age 53, comes from Arequipa but has lived in Ica for the past 7 years. For the past 4 years, she has lived in a rented room in Huacachina, Ica, where her daily work takes place. She has a 25-year-old daughter who is married and lives in Arequipa, and who sometimes sends money to her mother. F. A. Marilu is in charge of the bathrooms in Huacachina, and she also sells personal hygiene products outside of the same facilties. She has gained the trust of the leaders of the municipality because she has been very responsible. She is asking us to finance a loan to improve a location she has purchased in Huacachina with her savings. Her dream is to open a food business there in the future, which will allow her to earn a better income. The neighbors provide very positive references for her, saying that she is very hard-working and cooperative, and that she treats everyone with respect.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Preparing a location for a future business

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es:
Jovanna es una joven de 25 años que vive en la casa de sus padres. 
Hace dos años decidió ser independiente económicamente forjando su propio negocio de venta de comida en su restaurante. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su madre en la atención de los clientes, todos los días incluyendo los domingos.
Jovanna tiene muy buena sazón por lo que cada día sus comensales disfrutan de comidas deliciosas y sanas. Para ello, cada mañana se abastece de los ingredientes necesarios para las comidas y una vez terminadas sus ventas lava los platos y demás utensilios, dejando todo listo para la siguiente jornada.
Aunque el trabajo es agotador, para Jovanna es un gran disfrute tener su propio negocio, esta es la razón por la que mira al futuro con gran entusiasmo.

Esta es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal, así como puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes y en la mejora de su restaurante renovando los manteles de sus mesas y otros utensilios.
texts.en:
Jovanna is a young woman of 25 who lives in her parents house. Two years ago, she decided to become economically independent forming her own business, selling food in her restaurant. She depends on the help of her mother in attending to clients. Jovanna has good taste because everday her customers enjoy her tasty and healthy food. For this, every morning she supplies the necessary ingredients for the food and once finished with her sales, cleans the plates and utensils, leaving everything ready for the next day. Although the job is exhasting, for Jovanna it is enjoyable to have her own business. For this reason she looks at the future with much enthusiasm.

This is the fourth time that she has had credit with MFP. She is one of the most active clients in the communal bank as she is punctual in her payments. The money she is now soliciting, she will use in the purchase of ingredients and in the the improvement of her restaurant, changing her table cloths and other utensils.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food consumibles and utensils for the resaurant

loans.name: 18 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “18 de Agosto” esta representado por la señora Marcela y conformada por 13 miembros  que ya van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad, responsabilidad y unidad, la mayoría de las socias son de la misma zona y se conocen bastante bien de manera que es un grupo muy solidario por que entre todas se ayudan, los integrantes  son 9 mujeres y 3 varones. Entre las actividades que desempeñan esta la venta de ropa, comidas, empanadas, refrescos, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y entre los varones al servicio de albañilería, en plantas de cerámica y como empleados de fábricas.  La competencia es alta pero las socias trabajan duro para sacar sus negocios a flote y poder tener una ganancia que ayude con el pago de sus obligaciones y con el sustento diario de sus familias. El destino del financiamiento esta la compara de insumos, materiales y mercadería para surtir sus tiendas y sus negocios, algunos de los socios invertirán en la apertura de talleres, la compra de herramientas de trabajo y a la refacción de sus viviendas para que puedan brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The August 18th Communal Bank is led by Sra. Marcela and consists of thirteen members who are starting their second loan cycle. They have demonstrated punctuality, responsibility, and unity. Most of the members are from the same district and know each other fairly well, which is helpful when working together as a solidarity group. There are nine women and three men in the group. Among the retail businesses represented are the sale of clothing, food, empanadas, soft drinks, and groceries. The men provide masonry services, install ceramic floors, or work in factories. The level of competition is high, but the members work hard to keep their businesses afloat and earn enough income to meet their obligations and feed their families.

The loan will be used to acquire supplies, materials, and merchandise to restock their shops and businesses. Some of the members will invest the money to open new stores, purchase equipment, and renovate their homes so that they can provide their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es:
Lizet tiene 27 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en una casa arrendada.
Desde hace 6 años tiene una tienda de comestibles que instaló en su misma vivienda. La ventaja para su negocio es que se ubica en una calle bastante transitada y vende variedad de productos como leche evaporada, conservas, frutas, verduras, abarrotes, etc.
Sus padres la apoyan en la atención de su negocio, ya que es una fuente de ingresos para toda la familia. Durante estos años de trabajo Lizet se ha dado cuenta de que trabajar organizadamente y pendiente de las necesidades de sus clientes, la mantienen en la preferencia sus consumidores, esto le garantiza que sus ventas sean exitosas.
Sin embargo, su mayor reto es enfrentar la proliferación de nuevas tiendas en su localidad, pero esto no la desanima, ya que seguirá con la idea de marcar la diferencia.
Su deseo a futuro es convertir su tienda en un minimarket.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en MFP, además considera que tener varios años de experiencia en la administración exitosa de su negocio la favorecerá para responder puntualmente en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Lizet, 27, lives with her parents and her siblings in a rented house. For six years she has had a food store, which she set up in their house. The advantage the business has is that it is located on a well traveled street. She sells a variety of products like evaporated milk, canned goods, fruit, vegetables, and groceries, etc. Her parents help her take care of the store because it is a source of income for the whole family. During these years of work Lizet has realized that working in an organized way and being attentive to her customers’ needs makes her a favorite with her consumers. This guarantees that her sales are successful. Nevertheless, her biggest challenge is to face the proliferation of new stores in her area. But, this does not discourage her because she will continue with the plan of stressing the difference. Her wish for the future is to convert her store into a mini-market. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She feels that having several years of experience successfully running her business will help her make her payments on time. The money she is now requesting is to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La señora Blanca A., es madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, uno de los cuales está estudiando en la primaria. La señora  tiene una pequeña pulpería localizada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende desde golosinas hasta granos básicos y le sirven para mantenerse ella y sus hijos. Hace más de tres años que se dedica a este negocio, el cual inicio como una alternativa,  debido a que tenía a sus hijos que alimentar, por lo que se armó de valor y decidió establecer la pulpería. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías de la pulpería, principalmente desea invertir en útiles escolares que es lo que más están buscando sus clientes actuales. El deseo por el momento es trabajar duro para capitalizar el negocio, de tal forma que pueda en un futuro realizar mejoras a su casita, y brindarles mayores comodidades a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca A. is the single mother of two minor children. One of them is attending elementary school. She has a small mini-market in her home. She sells things from sweets to basic grains. This business allows her to support herself and her children. She has been in this business for three years. She started it because she had to feed her children. She armed herself with courage and decided to establish the mini-market. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the mini-market. She wants to invest primarily in school supplies, which is what her current customers are looking for the most. For now her wish is to work hard to reinvest in the business. That way in the future she will be able to make improvements to her house and give her children more amenities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Viviendas 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Viviendas 2” esta representado por la señora María  Luisa y conformada por 13 miembros que son padres de familia, que trabajan constantemente, para  poder sacar adelante a sus familias con sus negocios, son personas responsables y solidA. como lo han demostrado en lo seis ciclos que llevan juntas se conocen muy bien y saben que son gente trabajadora y emprendedora y por eso continúan juntas. Entre las actividades que realizan son las siguientes esta la venta de comida, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de ropa, venta de refrescos, pan , abarrotes, cosméticos y empanadas, entre los varones se dedican a  la refacción de aires acondicionados así como la reparación de refrigeradores y otros electrodomésticos. Dentro del ámbito competitivo podemos mencionar que no  tienen dificultades donde ellos ofrecen sus productos y sus servicios diariamente la ubicación de sus negocios son en lugares estratégicos de la cuidad de montero donde ellos tienen clientes fieles por tener años de experiencia en el rubro a que cada una de las socias se dedican, en  los casos de los hombres que se dedican a la prestación de servicios de reparación de aires acondicionados donde tienen convenios con instituciones durante una gestión completa por lo que no tienen ninguna dificultad económica. El crédito lo utilizaran,  en mejorar sus viviendas y negocios, la compra de insumos y materiales para la elaboración del pan, masitas, empanadas y salteñas, así como la compra de herramientas y equipos que ayuden a mejorar el servicio que brindan, algunas de las socias desean invertir en negocios nuevos con nueva mercadería para ofrecer.  Sus expectativas a futuro son ver sus negocios llenos de mercadería que se pueda vender y prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así generar mejores ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y mejorar sus productos acorde a las nuevas exigencias del mercado. La gran mayoría de los clientes tienen mucha experiencia de trabajar bajo la modalidad de banca comunal, este grupo es muy responsable por que si una clienta falta o se atrasa todo el grupo cubre la cuota de la persona, dando a conocer que ellos entienden y conocen la solidaridad y la unidad  que se requiere para ser un grupo solidario.
texts.en:
The group “Las Viviendas 2” is led by Sra. María Luisa and consists of thirteen members who are working parents who strive relentlessly to support their families through their businesses. They are responsible and cooperative people who have demonstrated in their previous six loan cycles that they are capable of working together. Now that they have had the chance to get to know each other well through their hard work, they look forward to continuing together as a group. Among the retail businesses represented are the sale of food, handmade dresses, clothing, soft drinks, bread, groceries, cosmetics, and empanadas. The men are engaged in the repair of air conditioners, refrigerators, and other appliances. With regard to the competitive environment, the members do have any difficulties because they offer their products and services every day from strategic locations throughout the city. Many of them have a loyal clientele that they have established as a result of many years of experience. For example, the members who provide air conditioning services do not face financial difficulty because they have agreements with institutions to provide comprehensive maintenance.

This loan will be used to improve their home and businesses. The members will purchase supplies and materials for making bread, snacks, empanadas, and salteñas, as well as tools and equipment to improve the services they provide. Others wish to invest in new businesses by acquiring a variety of merchandise to offer.
