Their expectations for the future are to see their businesses well–stocked so that they can provide better service to their customers and improve their product offerings so that they can keep up with new market demands, which will help them earn more income so that they can provide a better quality of life for their families. Most of the members are experienced in working as part of a solidarity group. They are aware that the entire Communal Bank is responsible for any shortfalls caused by any member who is late or fails to make a payment. In addition, they know that it takes cooperation and unity to work together as a solidarity group.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 73 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado pues todos le han sido de mucha ayuda en su negocio. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de cafetín. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, este negocio inicio con la intención de buscar mayores ingresos económicos y así poder darle a su familia lo necesario por lo que el servicio que ella brinda a sus clientes es el mejor. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como es jugos, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas y agua embotellada. Su deseo es seguir viviendo.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is 73 years old. This is not the first loan that she has asked for and all of the loans have been very helpful in her business. She works in providing the services of a coffee bar. She has been working in this humble business for more than ten years. This business began with her intention of looking for a better income to therefore be able to give her family the necessities for life, and for that, the service that she provides to her customers is the best. She is asking for this loan to purchase raw materials such as juice, soda, natural drinks, bread, cookies, and bottled water. Her desire is to continue living.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elcides Benjamín

texts.es:
El señor Elcides Benjamín C. C. es originario del municipio de sanjuán de Limay comunidad la guaruma del departamento de Estelí , se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería el usara el crédito para mantenimiento de su finca ya que en esta época el limpia todos sus potreros donde repasta los animales y repara los cercos para mantener en buenas condiciones la finca el actualmente quiere hacer mejoras  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mas de 10 años ya que su papa le enseño a trabajar en este rubro  y se a dedicado a esta actividad el tiene 170 mz de terreno y un total de 39 animales el cual a venido comprando y mejorando a través de su propio esfuerzo anteriormente se le financio un panel solar el cual es de mucha utilidad par el ya que en su lugar no hay luz eléctrica.

Elcides espera ayudarse mucho con el crédito ya que actualmente lo necesita para hacer sus labores  el es casado y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad el todavía no esta en edad escolar sus padres están bajo la responsabilidad de el y viven en la misma casa

Este es el segundo crédito que Alcides tiene con ceprodel en un periodo de un año el desea seguir trabajando con ceprodel ya que se a ayudo mucho con el crédito y quiere mejorar su finca y desea que ceprodel le brinde el servicio.
texts.en:
Sr. Elcides Benjamín C. C. is originally from the community of Guaruma in the city of San Juan de Limay, Department of Estelí. He is a farmer and rancher who is requesting a loan to maintain his farmland. During this time of year, he has to clear all the fields where is animals graze and repair the fences around his property to keep them in good condition. Elcides wants to make further improvements. He has worked as a farmer and rancher for more than ten years. His father taught him this trade and is now completely devoted to this way of life. He possesses 170mz of land (approximately 294 acres) and has a total of 39 animals that he bought and raised through his own efforts. He previously received a loan to acquire a solar panel, which has been very useful since his place does not receive electricity.

Elcides expects this loan will be of great help because much work needs to be done. He is married and has one child who is still too young to attend school. He still lives at home with his parents.

This is the second loan Elcides has received from CEPRODEL within the past year. He hopes to continue working with the organization since the loan he already received was a great help. Elcides wants to make further improvements to his farm and hopes that CEPRODEL will continue to be of service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his farm (purchase barbed wire & pay for labor to clear his land)

loans.name: Josué Ovidio

texts.es: Josué Ovidio N. G. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután y vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, quien le ayuda en el negocio y tres hijos que se dedican a estudiar. Él posee una venta de carne de res, la cual está ubicada frente a la parroquia de Ozatlán, en el departamento de Usulután, este lugar es muy concurrido y siempre cuenta con una gran afluencia de personas. Josué posee 23 años de dedicarse a este negocio, es por ello que es muy reconocido en el lugar, y cuenta con la confianza de sus clientes quienes aseguran que él es una persona muy trabajadora quien ha salido adelante gracias su esfuerzo y el de su esposa. Josué solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de carne, y así obtenerla a menor precio, también desea poder invertir en especias para dar sabor a las comidas. Josué desea mucho poder invertir más en el negocio de manera que pueda renovarlo después de tantos años y así poder obtener mejores ganancias, ofreciendo mayor cantidad de carne a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Josué Ovidio N. G. is 50 years old and lives in the department of Usulután. He lives in his own house together with his wife, who helps him in the business, and his three children who are studying. He owns a beef shop that is located in front of the parish of Ozatlán, in the department of Usulután. This place is busy and he can always count on a great crowd of people. Josué has been in this business for 23 years, and it’s for this reason that he is very well-known in the area. He counts on the confidence of his customers who assure that he very hard-working and has succeeded thanks to his own efforts and his wife’s efforts. Josué is asking for a loan through which he can have the money to buy a larger quantity of meat and therefore get a lower price. He also hopes to invest in spices to give flavor to the food. Josué would really like to invest more in the business so that he can renovate it after so many years and therefore be able to obtain a better income, offering a larger quantity of meat to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat and spices

loans.name: José Alcides

texts.es: José Alcides G. de 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio del Tránsito, ubicado en el departamento de San Miguel. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a trabajar y que dependen por completo de su padre. José tiene 3 años de poseer su negocio propio en el cual se encarga de comercializar frutas de  estación. José es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien desea seguir adelante con su negocio, él inicia sus ventas desde las 7 de la mañana cuando llega a su puesto de ventas en el mercado Municipal de San Miguel con una actitud muy positiva confiando en que ese día será mejor que el anterior. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor variedad de frutas al mayoreo, lo cual debe hacerlo al contado, razón por la cual necesita el efectivo para poder hacer esta compra, así mismo de esta manera, podrá obtener precios más bajos. José espera aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos los cuales se encargan de ayudar a José con los oficios del hogar, mientras su padre trabaja para llevarles el sustento diario a su mesa.
texts.en:
José Alcides G. is 47 years old and lives in the municipality of Tránsito, which is located in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his two children, ages 14 and 16, who work and also rely on their farther for support. José has been in business, selling fruits that are in season, for three years. He is a hard worker, who is responsible, and who wants to succeed in his business. He starts selling at seven in the morning when he arrives at his stall in San Miguel’s municipal market, arriving in a positive state of mind trusting that today will be better than yesterday. José is asking for loan so he can buy a greater variety of fruits at wholesale. He needs the cash to be able to buy his goods this way getting them for lower prices. José hopes to increase his sales and in this way provide his children, who help José with the housework while he works to bring them their daily bread, with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits.

location.town: El Transito, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: El señor Julio Alberto A., es casado y con su esposa y vive en el barrio la Francia su esposa se dedica a las actividades domésticas, ellos son mayores de edad y se dedican desde hace 25 años a la agricultura e iniciaron su actividad en este rubro gracias al apoyo de sus padres, dentro de las limitantes que se les ha presentado a lo largo de los años ha sido la poca financiacion que tiene esta actividad en Nicaragua, para esto el solicita se le beneficie con este credito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la cosecha, esto ayudara a la rapida venta de la producción, generandole a corto tiempo la recuperanción y las utilidades de lo invertido.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio Alberto A. and his wife live in the neighborhood of La Francia. His wife takes care of the household activities. All of their children are grown. Julio has been engaged in agriculture for 25 years and started in this trade with the help and support of his parents. One of the limitations he has had to deal with over the years is the scarce availability of funding available to farmers in Nicaragua. He will greatly benefit from this loan request and will use the funds to purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops. This will help him speed up the sale of his harvest so that he can recoup his investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Crecimiento De Jesús Group

texts.es:
Albina es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Albina se dedica a L. venta D. artesanías que elL. misma elabora tejiendo. Albina gracias a su buen manejo del dinero a podido hacer que su negocio crezca. Albina, requiere D. un préstamo con el cual comprara lanas e hilos por grandes cantidades para L. elaboración D. sus artesanías. Albina tiene como meta el poder tener una tienda propia, L. cual le genere  ingresos para poder pagar los estudios D. sus hijos.

Benancia es casada. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en su tienda D. abarrotes, L. cual tiene en su propia casa. Benancia, necesita un préstamo para comprar productos para surtir su negocio. Venancia tiene como meta, tener L. mejor tienda D. su comunidad, granD. y surtida.

Emilia es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Emilia, se dedica a L. venta D. coca y gaseosas, negocio que inicio con los prestamos que obtuvo, el cual crece cada día mas. Emilia, necesita un préstamo, con el cual comprar mas productos para vender. ElL. desea que sus hijos lleguen a estudiar en L. universidad y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Albina is married and has 6 children. Albina is dedicated to artesenia and also weaves. Albina, thanks to her handling of money, makes sure her business grows. Albina needs a loan with which she will buy wool and thread for the large quantities used in making her artensenia products. Albina has the goal that she can have her own store, which would generate the profits she could use to pay for her children's studies.

Bernancia is married. She sells necesities in her general store, which she has in her home. Bernancia needs a loan to buy products to sustain her business. Berancia has as her goal, to have the best business in her community, large and well-stocked.

Emilia is married and has 6 children. Emilia sells coca and sodas, a business which she started with the loans she obtained and which grows more everyday. Emilia needs a loan which she will use to buy more products to sell. She wishes her children will study at the univesity and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The clients are requesting a loan to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofía B. G. de 29 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su familia la cual está conformada por su esposo y cuatro hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Sofía posee una panadería en la cual elabora pan dulce, nombre que se le da al pan que es preparado con harina, miel, dulces, azúcar o leche. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, lugar en el cual hace 11 años empezó a dedicarse a dicho oficio, el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarle ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Sofía se encarga de elaborar los diferentes tipos de pan dulce, tales como magdalenas, semita con miel y otros más los cuales son muy típicos en la cultura salvadoreña. Así mismo ella se encarga de repartirlo con algunos clientes, los cuales compran al mayoreo, para obtener mayores ganancias en la panadería comercializa el pan por unidad el cual es muy consumido por sus vecinos. Sofía solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, azúcar, canela y nuevos instrumentos que se utilizan para la elaboración del pan, de manera que pueda ofrecer mayor cantidad y obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permiten brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Sofía B. G., 29, lives in Usulután department with her family, which is made up of her husband and four, school-age children. Sofía has a bakery in which she makes pan dulce (a term used to describe bread made from flour, honey, sweetners, sugar or milk). The bakery is in her home and she has been in this line of work for 11 years. Profits from her bakery have helped her to provide for her children and to help her husband meet household expenses. Sofía makes the various kinds of bread like: madeleines, honey-filled semitas (a tart of bread dough filled with jam or other rich fillings), and others which are very typical of Salvadorean cuisine. She is also in charge of distributing the product to some wholesale customers. In the bakery, she sells by the unit, mostly to her neighbors. Sofía is requesting funding to buy flour, sugar, cinnamon and some new tools she needs to bake bread so that she can offer better quality and produce higher earnings in order to provide her family with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and cinnamon.

loans.name: Gerson Jonathan

texts.es: Gerson Jonathan A. C. de 21 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su familia, la cual está conformada por su madre y tres hermanos menores los cuales son estudiantes de educación básica. Gerson posee una panadería en la cual se encarga de elaborar pan dulce (nombre el cual se le da al pan, el cual es hecho a base de harina, con miel o dulces, y su sabor es muy parecido al de las galletas). Gerson se encarga de elaborar el pan que luego sale a repartir a sus clientes, cabe mencionar que él cuenta con la ventaja de poseer una ruta trazada en la cual va entregando su producto. A pesar que cuenta con un año de poseer la panadería, él cuenta con muy buena reputación, por ser una persona muy responsable quien siempre entrega los pedidos a tiempo. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de harina, huevos, y todos los productos necesarios para la elaboración del pan. A su corta edad, Gerson es un joven el cual ha tomado la responsabilidad de un negocio, esforzándose a diario por llevarles el sustento diario a su familia, la cual colabora en el negocio, pero a pesar de esto es Gerson quien se encarga de administrar la panadería a lo largo del día.
texts.en:
Gerson Jonathan A. C., 21, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department, with his family, which is made up of his mother and three younger siblings, who are in elementary school. Gerson has a bakery in which he makes pan dulce (a type of bread made with flour, honey or sweets; its flavor is similar to a cookie). Gerson bakes the bread and then distributes to his customers. It's worth mentioning that he has a set route along which he distributes his bread. Although his bakery is only a year old, he has a very good reputation for being very responsible and always making his deliveries on time. He is requesting funding to buy flour, eggs, and the other needed ingredients for his bread. At his young age, Gerson is a young man who has taken responsibility for his business, struggling daily to provide support for his family. His family members help out with the business but it's Gerson who carries the main responsibility for running the bakery throughout the day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs and sugar.

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jenny N. de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, esta separada pero tiene 2 hijos estudiantes de escuelas fiscales. 

Jenny comenzó vendiendo comida en la ventana de su casa fue poco a poco teniendo ingresos suficientes para poder convertir el puesto de comidas en un bazar. 

Jenny ahora trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 21h00 de la noche, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas, fomix etc. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la falta de iluminación que hay en las calles de su casa.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una vitrina, cuadernos, plumas, hojas para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere poner una sucursal y también adecuar su casa para que ya no venda la papelería por la ventana.
texts.en:
Jenny N., 29, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil's beltway in a cement house that has all basic utilities. She is separated and has two children enrolled in public school. Jenny began selling prepared meals from a window in her house and bit by bit earned enough to make her food stall into a store. Now, Jenny works from 8am until 9pm selling notebooks, pens, styrofoam, etc. One of the difficulties she faces is the lack of street lighting in her area. She will use the funds to buy a display case, notebooks, pens, sheets of paper to enlarge her stock. In the future, she wants to open a branch of her store and also set up her house so that she doesn't have to sell her paper goods through her window anymore.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Display case, notebooks, sheets of paper.

loans.name: Mariela De La Concepcion

texts.es: Mariela tiene 34 años de edad, su actividad económica es abarrotería, hace más de 15 años, ella dio inicio a este negocio con muy pocos productos por lo que anteriormente su local era muy pequeño, y solamente tenía 2 canastas con los siguientes productos como frutas y cosméticos, poco a poco es que ha ido aumentando su negocio por lo que sus 2 hijos son los motivos suficientes por el cual ella tiene que seguir trabajando y luchando para seguir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así comprar los productos necesarios. El deseo de Mariela es mejorar su negocio y obtener lo necesario para el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Mariela is 34 years old. Her economic activity is a grocery store. More than 15 years ago, she began this business with very few products. Her location was very small, and she only had two baskets with products like fruit and cosmetics. Little by little she has augmented her business. Her two children are the motivation for which she continues working and fighting to move forward. The loan that she solicits is for capital for work and as such to buy necessary products. Mariela’s desire is to improve her business and obtain what is necessary to cover her daily needs.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for work

loans.name: José Vidal

texts.es: José Vidal R. P. de 40 años de edad, reside en San Martín, departamento de San salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar.  José posee una venta de materiales de construcción, los cuales José se encarga de repartir en algunas ferreterías de San Martín. Así mismo se encarga de hacer trabajos de construcción. Él cuenta con cinco años de poseer su negocio, y tiene la ventaja de poseer una ruta trazada de clientes. José solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder aumentar su inventario con más productos de construcción, tales como: ladrillos, arena barias y cemento. Para José es de mucha importancia el poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que este es la única fuente de ingresos con la que sus familia cuenta, es por ello que dentro de las metas de José está la de hacer crecer su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias, la cuales beneficien la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
José Vidal R. P. is 40 years old. He lives in San Martín, department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and their four young children who are dedicated to their studies. José has a shop of construction materials, which he is charge of distributing in some hardware stores in San Martín. As such he is responsible for doing construction work. He has been in possession of his business, and he has the advantage of having blazed a trail with his clients. José is asking for a loan with the goal of being able to increase his inventory with more construction products, such as bricks, sand and cement. For José, it is very important to be able to improve the conditions of his business, as it is the only source of income his family has. That is why José’s goals include growing his business and obtaining greater earnings, which will improve the economic stability of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando José R. M., Labora como Supervisor de Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene cinco  hijos a su cargo, y tres de esta en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado diez créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido diez créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra, para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás de su patio, por lo que esta estaba cerrado con alambre de púa y postes de madera.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 Fernando dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Sr. Fernando José R. M. works as a sanitation supervisor at the Mercado Mayoreo (a wholesale market) in Managua. He is married and has five children, three of whom attend school. He has worked with CEPRODEL for seven years and has received ten loans. During this period, he used the loans to make improvements to his home.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and stone in order to build a wall behind his yard. This area is currently closed off with barbed wire and wooden posts. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Fernando says he is grateful for the loans provided by CEPRODEL because they have helped him make his home much safer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall

loans.name: Humberto Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Humberto José Téllez T., Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene  cinco hijos a su cargo, y cuatro se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado siete créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, clavos, para su casa de habitación por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Humberto dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Humberto José Téllez T. works as a janitor in the Mayoreo (wholesale) Market in Managua; he is married and has 5 children under his responsibility, 4 of them are of school age. He has had seven loans with CEPRODEL in 7 years; during this period of time he has invested some loans to improve the house where he lives and he is thankful for the loans granted by CEPRODEL. The requested loan will be invested in buying construction materials such as roofing material and nails since his house is in poor condition and needs repairs; his objective is to provide more safety and a better quality of life for his children. Humberto said that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL he has benefited much since he now has a safer house.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements and additions

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia M. Machuca es una mujer luchadora, tiene 45 años, es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos de 11, 18, 21 y 24 años, se dedica día a día al cuidado de 7 niños, ya que tiene un pequeño huahuawasi (kindergarten), llamado “LAS FRESITAS”, desde hace 9 años se inicio en este negocio porque sus hijos estaban pequeños y necesitaban de su cuidado y eso no le permitía salir de casa, además Delia también se dedica a otras actividades como tejidos, bordados de polos y venta de ceviche los domingos, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado arreglar su casa de material noble, pero ella tiene un gran sueño que es techar su casa.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para las instalaciones de agua y desagüe, Delia agradece el apoyo brindado ya que le es de mucha ayuda, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delia M. Machuca is a hardworking woman of 45. She lives with a partner and has four children of ages 11, 18, 21, and 24. Her business is a “huahuawasi” [kindergarten] called “Las Fresitas” [Little Strawberries], where she cares for seven children each day. Delia started this business nine years ago because she needed a business where she could be with her young children. She also has other side businesses, such as sewing, embroidery, and selling ceviche on Sundays. As a result of her hard work, she has managed to fix up her house with good materials, and her biggest dream is to add a new roof. This loan will be spent on the installation of water and sewage plumbing to her house. She is grateful for the support provided, which is a big help in improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Water and drainage plumbing

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es: La señora Rosa Amanda tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos ya todos trabajan, La señora Rosa tiene la venta de comida ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 13 años, ella empezó vendiendo muy pocos productos por lo que anteriormente vendía gallo pinto, huevos y tajaditas, pero poco a poco fue aumentando su negocio, hasta llegar a ofrecer lo que tiene en los momentos. Sus compras generalmente las realizar en el mercado, ya que allí le llegan a vender la mayoría de artículos que ofrece. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería grande, en la cual venda todo tipo de artículos, que puedan brindar mayores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Amanda is 57 years old. She is married and has five children who are all already working. Ms. Rosa sells food from her house. She began this business 13 years ago. She began selling very few products. She sold gallo pinto (a traditional Nicaraguan dish of beans and rice), eggs, and plantain chips. Little by little she went augmenting her business until arriving to offer what she has at the moment. She generally makes her purchases in the market, as there they arrive to sell the majority of articles which she offers. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise. She dreams of being able to have a large grocery store in which to sell all kinds of items that could offer a larger income to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Antonio G. González, tiene una propiedad de 90 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 10 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos (frijol y maíz), 80 manzanas de área apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz,  la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar 4 toretes para desarrollo o Engorde, cada uno le costara U$ 250.00 DOLARES los cual el espera venderlos a un precio de C$ 350.00 DOLARES, tendrá un margen de ganancia de U$ 400.00 DOLARES al final o cuando él los venda. Este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 4 hijos quienes son mayores  de edad y le ayudaban en las actividades de trabajo en el campo a sembrar y cultivar hasta la cosecha de estos granos , este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, con la compra de estos toretes el espera tener una ganancia a la  fecha que él los ponga a la venta y de esa forma ir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y ala ves le ayudara a tener otra fuente de ingresos para él y su familia, esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
Don Manuel Antonio G. González, ha tenido 6 créditos  desde el año 2005 lleva 5 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos y oportunidades de trabajo para cuidar o cumplir con las obligaciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel Antonio G. González has a property of 90 Manzanas (1 Manzana = 1.68 acres) and he uses different areas for different activities: he has 10 Manzanas to plant basic grains (beans and rice) and 80 Manzanas are suitable for cattle. He focuses on planting basic grains for consumption such as beans and corn, activities for which he will use the loan. He will also buy 4 young bulls for growing and fattening; each bull will cost $250 (US dollars) and he hopes to sell them for $350 each, for a total profit margin of $400. He started growing basic grains only in the winter season, and he did the work with his family; he is married and has 4 children who are now adults but used to help him with the farm work to plant and harvest the grains. He has been doing this line of work for a long time and he continues doing it now. With the purchase of the bulls he hopes to make some profit at the time he sells them; the profit will help to improve his productivity, and to have an additional source of income for his family; this will allow him to improve their quality of life. Mr. Manuel Antonio G. González has had 6 loans since 2005 and has worked with Ceprodel for 5 years. The impact and benefits he has received from the loans are very important since they have allowed him to improve his agricultural activities which have resulted in a continued improvement of his quality of life; he has better income and more work opportunities to provide and fulfill his family responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 4 young bulls for growing

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Yaniris is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Solidarias 123 (Women in Solidarity), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural area where the economy is based around agriculture, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure, which is under construction, with her husband and her three children.

Yaniris is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and having grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a papelería (similar to a mini-office supply store) by purchasing a photocopier. She will use the profits from the business to invest to complete her home, as well as feed her children and pay for their school supplies. Her long-term goal is to finish her studies in the university, where she is majoring in business administration, and to have a prosperous business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es: Leyla tiene 45 años de edad, su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella tiene 2 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo. Por lo que busca la manera de salir adelante con su pequeño negocio. Ella inicio con esta actividad porque no tenía el capital suficiente para apoyar con los gastos de la familia ya que no tenía los ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que es destinado para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabones, gaseosas y jugos. Su deseo es aumentar los productos de su negocio para llegar hacer una gran pulperia.
texts.en:
Leyla is 45 years old. Her economic activity is a local store. She has been in this business for more than five years. She has two children but only one of them in under her care. This is why she is looking for the way the get ahead with her little business. She began this activity because she didn't have enough capital to support the family expenses since she didn't have enough income. The financing she is asking for is for working capital meant for the purchase of rice, sugar, beans, soaps, sodas and juices. Her wish is to increase her business' products to become a great store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martin De Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Martin de Jesús García V., Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene cuatro  hijos a su cargo, y dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado ocho créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines, para terminar de  entechar la casa donde vive.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Martin dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Martin de Jesús García V. works a hygienist in the Israel Lewites market in Managua. He is married and has four children, two of whom are school-aged. He has taken out eight loans with CEPRODEL over six years, three of which were used for improvements on his house. Thanks to the financing provided by CEPRODEL, he is an excellent client. This loan is for the purchase of construction materials, such as rafters and metal roofing, to complete the roof on his house. Martin says that thanks to the loans from CEPRODEL, his home is much more secure.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing materials

loans.name: Martha Ramona

texts.es: Doña Martha es una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera el cual ha trabajado  desde su juventud. Tiene 43 años de edad, procreo un hijo el cual cursa sus estudios. Su negocio  es la venta de  cosméticos, ropa y venta de comida ambulante y a veces se va  a los mercado a vender y en las diferente ruta que circulan por la capital de Managua, lleva varios años en el negocio, cuando inicio lo hizo con ahorros y el apoyo de su excompañero, luego con los financiamiento de Afodenic ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su vivienda. Con el crédito anterior logro poner el techo y la madera pero no le ajusto para terminar las paredes ya que todo esta caro. Es por eso con esta nueva solicitud desea terminar la construcción del cuarto, el cual hará las paredes para esto comprara: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro  y terminar la obra. Contenta por que aunque ahora no tiene el apoyo de su exposo esta logrando su objetivos de mejorar su casa como poder dar el apoyo en los estudio a su hijo. Gracias a los préstamo de la institución
texts.en:
Doña Martha is a hard working woman; a single mother who has worked since her youth. She is 43 years old. She had a child who is a student. Her business is the sale of cosmetics, clothes and as a street food vendor. Sometimes she also goes to the market to sell and in the different routes that circulate in the capital of Managua. She has been at her business for some years. When she started, she did it with her savings and the support of her ex-companion, later with the financing of Afodenic. She has been able to make improvements on her housing. With the previous credit she was able to put on a roof and the lumber but she wasn't able to finish the walls since everything is expensive. This is why with this new loan she wishes to finish the construction of the bedroom. The walls will be finished. For this she will buy: stone, sand, cement and iron and she'll finish the project. She is happy because although she no longer has the support of her ex husband, she is meeting her goals of improving her home and being able to aupport her son's studies. Thanks to the institution for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement and iron to finish the walls of the bedroom.

loans.name: Denis Dionisio

texts.es:
El señor Denis Dionisio Rodríguez Avilés, tiene una propiedad de 40 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 4 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos(frijol y maíz) y Hortaliza , 2 manzanas sembradas de café y 44 manzanas de área apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz y a cultivos de hortaliza tecnificado, también a la caficultura,(cultivo de café) las cuales también cultivan y cosecha cada año  la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar insumos agrícolas los que utilizara en una manzana del cultivo de la papa. Este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 3 hijos 2 de ellos ya son mayores  de edad estos le ayudaban en las actividades de trabajo en el campo a sembrar y cultivar hasta la cosecha de estos granos ,  este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, y con la siembra del cultivo de la papa  el obtendrá más ingresos en el momento que el saque la cosecha, esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
Don Denis Rodríguez, ha tenido 10 créditos  desde el año 2001 lleva 9 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Denis Dionisio Rodríguez Avilés has a property of 40 manzanas [about 68 acres] with different areas for various crops. Four manzanas are used to grow basic grains (beans and corn) and vegetables. Two manzanas are planted in coffee, and 44 manzanas are appropriate for cattle. Denis takes care of the grain, vegetable, and coffee crops, including annual planting and harvesting. The purpose of this loan is for supplies necessary for growing one manzana of potatoes. Denis began by growing crops only in the wintertime and with the help of his family. He is married and has three children. Two of the children are grown and help out in the fields. Denis dedicates all of his time to this business, and with the addition of the potato crop, he will increase his earnings. Denis has had ten loans with Ceprodel over the last nine years. These have been important in allowing him to improve his business activities. The result has been higher income and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed potatoes, fertilizer, and wages for labor

loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es:
El Señor Pablo Roberto Chavarría García, Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado ocho créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido ocho créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Hierro y para terminar de  construir una pared de su casa por lo que este se encontraba en mal estado.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Roberto Chavarría García works as a hygienist in the Israel Lewites Market of Managua. He has 2 children under his charge, both school aged. He is married and has had 8 loans with CEPRODEL in the last 6 years. During this time, he has invested all 8 loans in improving the house he lives in, thanks to financing by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The solicited loan is to invest in buying construction materials like cement and iron, and to finish constructing a wall of his house that is currently in bad shape. His object is to offer greater security and a better condition of life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: HOME IMPROVEMENT AND EXPANSION

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La Sra. Betty, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años  y es madre de 02 hijas menores, que aun dependen de ella.Su carácter alegre y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa un lugar muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará paquetes de papel, fideos , leche en caja y conservas de pescado y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Betty como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Betty is a member of the community bank “Los Eucaliptos”, in the District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is married, 37 years old and the mother of 2 young daughters under her care. Her cheerful character and yearning to fulfill her dreams motivated her to establish her own business selling groceries where the profits would contribute to her household income. From the time she started until now, she has been gaining customers. Her business is located in her own house in a well-organized location. Nowadays, she enjoys loyal customers that visit her store daily because they can find all the products that a housewife would need and she personally assists them with the charisma that characterizes her. With the loan of S/. 2,500 she will buy packaged paper, noodles, boxed milk, canned fish (various types and brands), crates of eggs and personal hygiene products in order to continue improving the service to her customers. Betty, as people affectionally call her, feels very good and hopes to continue working; she is very thankful to the organization Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities for development in their respective environments.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to supply her business

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Rolando Antonio C. V., Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y uno en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado cinco créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cinco créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y cerámica, para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Rolando dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Señor Rolando Antonio C. V. works as a hygiene inspector in Managua’s Israel Lewites market. He cares for two children, one of whom is of school age. He is married and has had five loans with CEPRODEL in the past four years. During this period, he has invested these loans in the improvement of the house in which he lives. He is an excellent client.

The loan applied for will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, and ceramic tiles for the construction of a bathroom in his dwelling, with the goal of offering greater security and a better living conditions to his children. Rolando said that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL he has been helped a great deal and now can count on a more secure lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and enlarging a house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aura Marcia

texts.es:
La señora Aura Marcia A., vive en una comunidad de san Rafael del sur, ella es casada con 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son de edad escolar, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de guineos y plátanos estos los compra en el mercado Municipal de san Rafael del sur y luego los comercializa en su comunidad, ella está solicitando su préstamo para poder incrementar su negocio ya que si compra por 2 o 3 cabezas de guineos le dan un precio más bajo y así ella también dará un precio menor y sus ventas se incrementaran obteniendo ella más ganancias.

Tiene 4 años de estar trabajando con Ceprodel de los cuales ha sido beneficiada con 8 prestamos estos los había utilizado para mejorar su casa de habitación, pero ahora lo necesita para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura Marcia A. lives in the community of San Rafael del Sur. She is married with 4 children, 2 of whom are school-age. She deals in guinea-hens and plantains, which she buys in the Municipal Market of San Rafael del Sur, then sells in her community. Aura is soliciting a loan to be able to increase her business. If she buys 2 or 3 head of guinea-hens at once, she gets a lower price and, then, she can offer them at a better price, and her sales will increase, producing more earnings. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and has benefited with 8 loans. Past loans have been used to improve the house she lives in, but now she needs a loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING GUINEA-HENS BY THE HEAD AND PLANTAINS

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Fátima del Rosario G., Labora día a día en el mercado Israel Lewite de Managua vendiendo golosinas, galletas, jugos y frutas.
Fátima va usar el crédito en compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Ella quiere el crédito para abastecer su negocio.
Su negocio empezó cuando Fátima dejo de trabajar como domestica, fue entonces cuando decidió poner su propio negocio.
Fátima ha tenido su propio tramo en el mercado para 15 años trabaja de 10 am a 6pm todos los días.
Ella espera que con este  préstamo su inventario incremente por lo que ahora tendrá mas productos para ofertar.
Fátima es madre soltera de dos hijos y uno de ellos se encuentra en edad escolar.
Este es el crédito numero 22 que ha tenido con ceprodel. Ha trabajado con ceprodel durante 5 años.
Fatima dijo que sus créditos con ceprodel le han ayudado mucho a crecer su negocio y mejorar su casa
texts.en:
Fátima del Rosario G. works every day in the Israel Lewite market in Managua, where she sells candies, cookies, juices, and fruits. Fátima is going to use the loan to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her business. She decided to set up her own business when she left her former job as a housekeeper. Fátima has had her own stall in the market for 15 years and works every day from 10 am to 6 pm. She hopes to increase her inventory with this loan so that she will have more products to offer. Fátima is a single mother with two children, one of whom is of school age. This is Fátima’s 22nd loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 5 years. Fátima says that her loans with CEPRODEL have helped her a lot in growing her business and improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of cookies, juices, and candies

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Yadira S. B. es una ama de casa con 02 hijos en edad escolar ella es casada, y se dedica al negocio de la elaboración de nacatamales y de fritanga, los días de semana ella hace fritanga como es tajada con queso, tacos, enchiladas y los fines de semana hace nacatamales los cuales los vende únicamente sábado y domingo, ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus nacatamales como es la carne de cerdo ella quiere comprar un cerdo vivo y ella misma destazarlo y comercializarlo ya que así le saldrá la carne un poco más baja que comprándola por libra, además comprara maíz, y otros productos que lleva los nacatamales.
texts.en:
Yadira is a housewife with two children of school age. She is married and she has a business making food similar to tamales and fried foods. On week days she makes fried food which is shared with cheese, tacos, and enchiladas and at the weekend she makes tamales which she sells only on Saturday and Sunday. She requests a loan to buy raw materials such as pork for making her tamales. She wants to buy a pig and butcher and market it herself as this will make the meat a little less expensive than if she buys it by the pound. She will also buy and other products that are in tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making tamales

loans.name: Yazohara

texts.es: La señora Yazohara R. es una Joven señora de  27 años es casada con un hijo de edad escolar, ella necesita ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa es por eso que tomo la iniciativa hace 05 años de vender ropa nueva y usada esta mercadería la comercializa en su comunidad ya tiene varias clientes las cuales les hacen encargo como ropa, zapato, cosméticos entre otras cosas, es por ella que ahora necesita un crédito ya que se iniciara el ciclo escolar y tiene varios encargos como camisas de uniforme, pantalones ropa interior para niñas y calcetas escolares, ella ha trabajado con Ceprodel hace 4 años en este tiempo ha tenido 8 créditos los cuales los ha pagado de una forma muy puntual, estos préstamos le ha ayudado a salir adelante con su hija y su esposo
texts.en:
Yazohara R. is 27 years old, married, and has one child of school age. She needed to help her husband with the household expenses, and so 5 years ago she took the initiative and began selling new and second-hand clothing. She markets this merchandise in her community and already has a variety of customers who order clothing, shoes, and cosmetics from her, among other products. She now needs a loan because the school term is about to begin and she has various orders for items such as school shirts, pants, girls’ underwear, and school socks. Yazohara has worked with Kiva partner CEPRODEL for 4 years. During that time she has had 8 loans and has paid all of them very punctually. These loans have helped her to get ahead with her daughter and her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing school clothing

loans.name: Esmilda Selena

texts.es: Doña Esmilda Selena R. se Dedica a la elaboración de refrescos naturales y venta de hielo y helados, ella es casada con 02 hijas en la universidad con muchas dificultades las ha podido sacar adelante, ella necesita un préstamo para comprar materia prima como son frutas, azúcar, y otros ingredientes que utiliza para hacer sus refrescos además de estos ella vende hielo y helados, tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel en los cuales ah tenido tres préstamos y estos le han serviso de mucho ya que con uno de ellos lo utilizo para gastos universitarios de su hija ayudándole a que se graduara y así mejorar su condición de vida
texts.en:
Esmilda Selena R. earns a living making natural drinks and selling ice and ice cream. She is married and has 2 daughters who are studying at the university level; after much difficulty she has been able to get ahead. She needs a loan so that she can purchase raw ingredients such as fruits, sugar, and other items that she will use to make beverages, in addition to selling ice and ice cream. She has worked with Kiva partner CEPRODEL for 3 years, and in that time has had 3 loans. These loans have helped her a lot, since she used one loan to pay for one of her daughters' university expenses, which will in turn help her to graduate and thus improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for making natural drinks

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El sr Walter S. su negocio es venta de CD y accesorios y películas de video está situado en la costado oeste del mercado municipal este tramo el lo alquila mensualmente paga una cuota, el dinero lo solicito para compra de CD, DVD película y limpiador de CD. El negocio lo empieza vendiendo CD en una esquina ponía su bolso con los CD pero después vio que tenía muchos clientes y decido alquila ese local tiene 3 años de estar alquilando antes vendía CD ambulante el sr S. es casado  tiene un bebe de 4 años y su esposa está embarazada esperando el segundo bebe, el necesita un préstamo para poder incrementar aun mas su negocio ya que le están pidiendo más películas y ahorita él no tiene capacidad de invertir más en su negocio ya que el capital propio que tenia  ahorrado lo utilizo para preparar a su esposa ya que pronto dará a luz a su nuevo hijo
texts.en:
Walter S. has a business in which he sells CDs and accessories along with movie DVDs. His business is located on the western edge of the city market; his stall has a monthly rent, which he pays in installments. The money he is asking for is for purchasing CDs, movies on DVD, and CD cleaner. He started his business as a street vendor, selling CDs out of a bag on a corner. After he saw that he had many customers he decided to rent this stall, which he has had for 3 years now. Walter is married and he and his wife have a 4-year-old; his wife is pregnant and they are expecting their second child. He needs a loan so that he can increase his business even more, since his customers are ordering more movies and right now he doesn’t have the means to invest more in his business. That is because Walter is saving his own capital to use for preparations for his wife, since she is due to bring their newest child into this world very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing CDs and movie and music video DVDs

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: El sr, franklin M. R. tiene 25 años trabaja en la capital Managua su oficio es operador técnico desempeña el cargo de operador técnico en cementera de pozo geotérmico el crédito lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción de la terminación de su casa como: cemento, arena. Cerámica y la mano de obra. El sr M. siempre ha trabajado para mantener a su familia la cual consta de tres niños y su esposa los crédito le han venido ayudar mucho ya que él siente que ha podido realizar sus sueños en tener su casita para su niñitos y se siente muy agradecido con Ceprodel ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con Ceprodel y espera seguir trabajando con nosotros.
texts.en:
Franklin M. R. is 25 and works in the capitol city of Managua, Nicaragua, as a technical operator in a geothermic cement factory. He is seeking a loan to buy materials to complete the construction of his home, including cement, sand, ceramics, and manual labor. Franklin has always worked to support his family, which consists of three children and his wife. These loans have helped him greatly and he feels that they have helped him to realize his dream of having a little house for his children. He is very grateful to Kiva partner Ceprodel, which has facilitated four loans for him. Franklin hopes to continue working with Ceprodel in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials, including bricks, cement, and manual labor.

loans.name: Malado

texts.fr: Malado S. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et a eu 4 expériences avec le crédit. Son objectif est de poursuivre son activité d'élevage de moutons et de se procurer des bénéfices afin de mieux prendre en charge sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Malado S. is a 38-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de SIWAL for two years and has had four experiences with loans. Her goal is to pursue her business raising sheep and to acquire some profit, so as to support her family better and to boost her saving.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her investment capital

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: El sr, Alex A. López es mecánico trabaja en la alcaldía municipal tiene 4 años de laborar para dicha institución el crédito lo solicita para remodelación de su casa ya que necesita compara una arena, cemento, piedrín y hierro para terminar de construirla el ha sentido muy bien el impacto de los crédito que ha tenido con ceprodel ya que han venido a mejorar su vida familiar solo así el pudo construir su vivienda, ha tenido tres créditos con ceprodel, es casado tiene una familia de 5 el cual es tres niñitos su esposa y el. Espera que siempre tenga la oportunidad de que le brinden créditos para poder seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Alex A. López is a mechanic and he has been working in the city hall for 4 years. He is asking for a loan to remodel his house since he now needs to buy sand, cement, gravel, and iron to finish building it. The loans that he has received from Ceprodel have made a big impact on his life. He sees the improvement in the standard of living of his family. This is the only way he has been able to build his home: with the three loans he has received from Ceprodel. Alex has a family of five: three small children, his wife, and himself. He is hoping to always have the opportunity to receive these loans so that he can continue making improvements on their home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials such as sand, and cement blocks

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen B. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 36 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ellen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ellen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita M. is from the village of Digkilaan, Tablon, Iligan City. She is 55 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Anita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tablon, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye B. est une femme de 58 ans, elle mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et a eu 4 expériences avec le crédit. Son objectif est de développer son activité de  d'embouche bovine afin de se procurer des ressources financières qui lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge familiale
texts.en:
Ndèye B. is a 58-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de SIWAL for two years and has had four experiences with loans. Her goal is to develop her business fattening cattle in order to acquire the financial resources to enable her to take part in covering family expense.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her investment capital

loans.name: Woly

texts.fr: Woly D. est âgée de 49 ans, elle mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et été 4 fois bénéficiaire de prêts. Elle fait de l'élevage de moutons, d'arachide, et de haricots. Elle participe aux charges collectives de sa famille.
texts.en:
Woly D. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for two years and has been a recipient of loans four times. She raises sheep, and she grows peanuts and beans. She takes part in covering the collective expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her commercial businesses

loans.name: Fatimata Ousmane

texts.fr: Fatimata Ousmane S. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine depuis plus de 3 ans, cette activité lui procure des ressources financières qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Fatimata Ousmane S. is a 58 year old woman, she is married and has 4 children. She has been a member of a "Banc Villageois" for 2 years. She has been fattening cows for over 3 years, and this activity provides her with the financial means to bear part of her family's expenses and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital investment

loans.name: Sainoding

texts.en:
Sainoding R. lives in the village of San Roque, Barinaut Iligan City. He is 21 years old, single, and makes a living running a habal-habal (or motor vehicle transport) business to people in his community. Sainoding has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP from his work.

In 2010, Sainoding joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve his life and business. He has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP, his first from our organization, to buy materials he needs to improve his customer service.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to improve his ability to serve his customers

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta S. lives in Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 60 years old, married and has one grown child. To make a living, she makes and sells food, mostly bread, salted fish and other items. She has been in business for more than 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Vicenta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she used to buy supplies to make more food. She is applying for a new loan, for 15,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve her living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is a leading cooperative in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina P. is from the village of Tablon, Digkilaan Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Gina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina and her husband own & operate a "habal-habal" or motor vehicle transport. Her husband serves as a driver for their vehicle. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for motor vehicle maintenance. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For maintenance of motor vehicle transport.

location.town: Tablon, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nos

texts.en: Nos S. R., 39, is a fish seller who started her business more than eight years ago. She has a partner in her husband, who works as a domestic carpenter. The couple has been married many years, and they have three young school-aged children. Nos S. R. always uses her old motorcycle to deliver fish to the market.  Unfortunately her motorcycle is prone to breakdowns.  To solve this problem,  Nos S. R. has requested a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the broken one. Not: Nos S. R. was busy selling her fish when the photo taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Cali

texts.en:
Cali T. is from the village of Labi, in Digkilaan in the city of Iligan. She is 48 years old. Cali is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Cali owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling a variety of home utensils within the local community. Cali has been engaged in her business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cali joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cali is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan is the first she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated through this loan to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Labi, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Carmelita's Group

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is 47 years old and married with six adult-aged children. She lives in the village of Mambabanga, a barangay of the municipality of Luna in Isabela province on Luzon. Carmelita is the leader of a ten-member group that received a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carmelita owns and operates a retail store from which she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. She has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

This year Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to their financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and maintain working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and obtain working capital.

loans.name: Julie Mae

texts.en:
Julie Mae P. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is twenty-nine years old. Julie Mae is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Julie Mae owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready-to-wear items like pants, shirts, and more in the local community. Julie Mae is just starting this business.

In 2009, Julie Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie Mae is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Julie Mae's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: Carmen Alicia R. A. de 49 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas. Carmen posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos  comestibles y de primera necesidad. A pesar de que cuenta con muy poco tiempo de tener la tienda, cuenta con muchos clientes, es por esto que ella tiene la necesidad de poder incrementar su inventario, por el hecho de que no posee muchos productos para ofrecer, por ser un negocio nuevo. Carmen solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos perecederos como huevos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, como también bebidas y golosinas. Ella es una persona quien se ha esforzado mucho por poder brindarles lo mejor a sus hijas, es por ello que nació la idea de tener un negocio propio, ya que esto beneficiaria en gran manera la economía de su hogar. Razón por la cual Carmen deposita sus esperanzas en poder mejorar sus ganancias gracias al préstamo solicitado, puesto que será este el que le permitirá invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen Alicia R. A. is 49 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Carmen owns a store where she sells food and basic staples. Although she has only recently opened her store, she has many customers and because of this she needs to be able to increase her inventory as she currently does not have many products to offer given that hers is a new business. Carmen is asking for a loan with which to buy perishables such as eggs, rice, beans, sugar as well as drinks and candies. She is someone who has worked very hard in order to give the best to her daughters and it is for them that she came up with the idea of opening her own store as it is of great benefit to the household's finances. This is why Carmen is placing her hope in being able to improve her earnings thanks to this loan as it is what will allow her to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable goods for resale

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhem S., age 60, owns a plot of farmland where she plants a variety crops, including rice, morning glory, cucumber, and cabbage, that she sells when they mature. She also relies on income form her son who works in construction field. Nhem S. lives with her four teenage children who are employed at a various jobs. She has another two children who are married and have started new homes. 

Nhem S. has a son who has a skilled in repairing machinery and she wants to encourage him use his knowledge to earn money, but he needs materials. Because Nhem S. lacks money, she decided to request a loan to purchase repair materials so her son can provide his service.

loans.use: To purchase repair materials

loans.name: Rosa Cándida
